story:
Short Summary

Meek Entertainment & PR  Presents -The Truth Stage Play 

    Mission

    Meek Entertainment & PR  is an Independent Production Company/PR Firm based in Los Angeles, Ca, Independently producing Live/Stage Events, Talent Showcases, Shorts,TV and Film projects and other media from 1998-Present. 

    Meek Entertainment & PR's mission is to tell compelling stories that Empower, Educate, and Entertain you about forgiveness, love, redemption and family and leave the audience with a positive message whether the project be Faith-based or a Universal theme. Our slate of projects include: Live Event Production and PR, Webisodes, Reality TV, Situational Comedies, Sketch Comedy, Stageplays (Dramedies), Feature Films, Books, and Music. 

    Vision

    Meek Entertainment & PR was derived from it's creator's name...(Tymeka with Meek for short) created in 1998 with the scripture in mind -"Blessed are the Meek for they Shall Inherit The Earth." Matthew 5:5

    The Founder/CEO of Meek Entertainment & PR- Tymeka "Meek" Coney's vision is to inspire and excel others lives mentally, emotionally and spiritually through creativity. She would like to create jobs through all of the projects that she has created and developed as well as continue to form partnerships with other entities to help bring their visions to life through Writing/Production.

    Meek Entertainment & PR  has created/hosted several successful events that were well-attended. 

    PRODUCTION TIMELINE

 In 1998-Meek Entertainment & PR  was created.  

Meek Entertainment & PR hosted The 1st Annual Delta Sigma Theta Homecoming Talent Showcase Featuring Sororities and Fraternities competing in a Step Show combined with local artists competing in a Talent Show at Texas Tech University-Lubbock, Texas. 

In the same year Meek Entertainment & PR created/hosted "Tribute to Motown" where they had several local artists dress up as Motown legends, Smokey Robinson, The Supremes, Stevie Wonder and Martha and the Vandellas and perform their hit songs dedicated to these legends also a talent competition held at Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas. 

In 1999-Meek Entertainment & PR created a Poetry Showcase to showcase local poets in a competition for 1st place.  

In 1999-Meek Entertainment & PR also created/hosted A Black History Month week of events that featured the late Yolanda King daughter of Civil Rights leader Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., in a performance along with other events that educated us on Black History held at Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas.

In 2000-Meek Entertainment & PR created/hosted another Poetry Showcase featuring local Neo-Soul artists and Dallas's best Poets competing for the number one spot at KD Studio Actor's Conservatory in Dallas, Texas.

In 2006-Meek Entertainment & PR partnered with Our Moni Productions to produce the short film Mahoghany Blues created as a vehicle to sale the feature film Mahoghany Blues. 

In 2006-Meek Entertainment & PR partnered with Crazy Kar Films to produce the TV Pilot Me and My Old Man. 

In 2008-Meek Entertainment & PR partnered again with Ourmoni Productions to produce an original TV Pilot Common Bond currently being shopped to Networks. 

In 2008- Meek Entertainment & PR was a producer for "The Urbanwear Curvie Couture" Fashion show held at The Celebrity Centre International.

In 2008 -Meek Entertainment & PR produced the 1st Annual Unsigned Artists Showcase in conjunction with UAHollywood whose purpose was highlighting music events while Meek Entertainment & PR kept the production and promotional end in motion. This event was inspired by the 2008 Presidential Election to raise political awareness and urge everyone to vote with the purpose of "Campaign for Change" and watch L.A.'s Unsigned artists compete for fame. With 25-30 of L.A.'s Hottest Unsigned Artists and a host of record labels and music industry guests -Meek Entertainment & PR wanted to remind everyone to go out and vote while raising political awareness and providing a platform for local Los Angeles artists to also receive a vote as they showcased their talent competing for a record deal.

In 2010-Meek Entertainment & PR produced The DVD/Stage Play "The Truth" currently pending distribution. 

In 2010- Meek Entertainment & PR Wrote, Cast & Produced "A Brand New Day" 

A Christmas Skit Held @ City of Refuge in front of an audience of 5,000+ members .

In Feb. 2011- Meek Entertainment & PR Wrote, Directed and Produced a Black History Series "From Civil Rights to the Dream" with at risk youth and a Cast and Crew of 50+ on Stage/DVD Held@ City of Refuge in front of an audience of 5,000+ members.

In April 2011- Meek Entertainment & PR Wrote, Directed and Produced a Modern day adaptation of the Story of Easter "Father Forgive Them, For They Know Not What They Do" with at risk youth and a Cast and Crew of 50+ on Stage/DVD Held@ City of Refuge n front of an audience of 5,000+.

On August 18, 2012, Meek Entertainment & PR partnered with

the Koinonia Alliance to Produce "Let Your Dreams Sparkle"- Music Workshop & Showcase  which was a Celebration of Music, Whitney Houston & the new movie "Sparkle." Guests were 102.3 KJLH Radio On Air Personality Tammi Mac, Willie Norwood- Father of Grammy winner Brandy & Ray J & Owner of Knockout Vocal Studios/Norwood Talent Agency,Courtney Leonard -Music Producer, Eugene Luckett- Music Marketing&Distribution, Marilyn Batchelor TV& FILM Music License Executive, Margie Balter- Piano Teacher to the Stars, Oronde Jenkins-Publishing Admin.@ Warner Music Group & 15 Vocalists singing Whitney Houston's Greatest Hits & The Music Community & Friends.

October 27, 2012, Meek Entertainment & PR joined forces with Shekinah Glory Ministries at the Los Angeles Convention Center and Produced-"The Fashion Show Extravaganza" as a Fundraising Event for Shekinah Glory Ministries.  Meek Entertainment & PR scouted 15-25 Models and 5 Designers to walk the Runway and Highlight their Designs and their Swag. The Fashion Show was Coordinated and Produced by Tymeka Coney Producer and Executive Produced by Hairstylist & Singer Cedric Hanna.

Nov. 3, 2012, Meek Entertainment& PR Produced & Hosted an event to urge the Community to go out and Vote in the 2012 prior to the Re-election of President Barack Obama. The Event was titled "Step Up and Vote for Change" which was a Step Show involving the National Pan-Hellenic Greek organizations in Los Angeles as well as a Edutainment event Merging Education and Entertainment. The show highlighted some political leaders in our community as well as local entertainers. Guests included: Assemblyman Mike Davis, Pastor Sherman Gordon an Evening w/Pastor G KJLH, A letter of Recognition from Mayor Antonio Villaraigosa, and Local Artists- Lemo Coney from MTV's The Score & It's Showtime @ The Apollo, Nicole Caldwell, Cedric Hanna, Taste of Soul Finalist Solomon Gilstrap etc....Sponsors included: Just Glam Cosmetics, Ralph's Grocers, Wingstop (Crenshaw location), Pitbull Energy drinks, and Sesac Music.  

2013- Meek Entertainment & PR Continues to promote the new book from Author/Spoken Word Artist Tymeka Coney- "Words Unspoken Volume I- Deeper Than Eyes Can See" and Meek Entertainment & PR is also continually promoting the release of the Spoken Word CD by Spoken Word Artist Tymeka (Tyme' LaShae) Coney "Life, Love and the Pursuit of Dreams." 

April 2014- Meek Entertainment & PR supported the Non -Profit organization African Focus with their Annual African Goodwill Awards as a Producer/Documentarian/Host in front  of an audience of 300-500+ international guests.
July 19, 2014-Meek Entertainment & PR partnered with the Esther Project Outreach Services Non-Profit organization to produce and promote the"1st Annual Women's Youth Symposium" to an audience of 250+ youth in the Los Angeles and surrounding communities about Bullying, Sex-Trafficking, Self-Esteem, Teen Dating Violence, Gang Affiliation, Media Exploitation.  

  • ABOUT THE TRUTH 

    • We would like to introduce you to an amazing play that not only entertains, empowers, and inspires the audience, but one that sends a lesson to the community about reconciliation in love and relationships.  The play also touches on topics related to the importance of friendships, marriage, healthy sexual behaviors, and practices. It educates our youth and others in the community about health awareness, specifically given attention towards the HIV/Aids epidemic, domestic violence, and homelessness, employment, and relevant social issues. In addition to relational and health matters, the story also provides business education.

    The main theme or central point of the story is about exercising forgiveness and redemption in relationships and most of all communicating with others by telling

    “The Truth”

  • We want to bring you an experience and a message to change your life that you can carry with you for life. We want to not only Educate you and Empower you but Entertain you and most importantly share with you "The Truth."

    “The Truth Stage Play” will bring awareness to Domestic Violence,  Mental Health, Marriage and Divorce, Homelessness, Health Awareness, Entrepreneurship and Unemployment and other social issues that affect our communities. 

    This Stage Play is for the entire community and we need your support to help reach and touch lives.  

Quote from Meek- "Having started out in the business as solely a talent, I recognize the importance of having a door of opportunity to showcase that talent. Now after formerly being one of the managers of a girl group "One Luv" in 2004 where she discovered one of the girls of the trio to going to the studio every day as the girls worked with various industry producers to performing at various industry showcases to making the phone calls to the record labels to shop the deal until the girls all decided to go their separate ways and with Casting experience and Coaching young actors Meek says, "I realize that I always want to work with talent and see them reach their full potential and as I continue to create and pursue my dreams in Entertainment/The Arts, I will also be one that continues to create opportunities for others in my quest as I remain "Meek" in my mission."

What We Need & What You Get

We all know a great Stage Play production's basic needs are :

Costumes
Props

Venue

Hair 

Make up

Wardrobe

Lights 

Sounds

Set Design 

Set Building

Marketing 

Merchandise

Stage Talent & Crew Etc..

In return for your generous contributions some of the items you will receive are: 

The Truth Gift Bags

The Truth Soundtrack

The Truth DVD

The Truth Poster

The Truth T-Shirt

Tickets to the Show

Cast Photos and Autographs

VIP Reception

Limousine Ride to the Show

Your Name & or Your Organization's  Name or Product will be mentioned in our Play Bill/Souvenir Booklet, on our Social Media sites,  Radio, Newspaper and other Marketing for our event and on Stage in front of our audience the night of the show.

The Impact

Your donation is going to assist us with spreading a positive message to the masses  and creating opportunities for artists in our community and providing answers and information to some of the issues that have immensely affected our communities. No donation is too big or small as you will aid us in some capacity to bring this vision  to life as well as change lives. 
Over a span of 15 years+  Meek Entertainment & PR has worked diligently to stay consistent in Educating, Empowering and Entertaining our world both individually and collectively through various projects and we are excited to partner with you to continue this movement. 

Risks & Challenges

  • We realize the importance of quality and presentation and we want to share that experience in excellence with you. 
  • We would like this to be the first show of many more to come and we know there is a lot of work that goes into the pre-production as well as production and marketing of a Live Stage Event and with your support we can minimize some of the challenges often faced and focus more on the story we want to share with you.

Other Ways You Can Help

We encourage you to not only support monetarily but spread the word to your Friends and Family, Business associates, Churches, Organizations, Phone lists via text and Email lists etc. We invite you to like and join our The Truth Stage Play Social Media pages as well as follow the play on http://coneyonline.wix.com/the-truth

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Share our Indiegogo link across the world wide web as well as on your Facebook and with your Facebook groups, Twitter, Instagram,LinkedIn, Pinterest, Youtube, Blogs and other Social Media pages.
We look forward to seeing you and your guests at our Live Show!!!


We thank you in advance for your time and consideration and most importantly your giving and we know that you are going to enjoy "What's In It For You!!"

  • YOU SHALL KNOW THE TRUTH...... COMING SOON TO THE STAGE 2015!!!!!

Short Summary
Meek Entertainment & PR  Presents -The Truth Stage Play 


Mission
Meek Entertainment & PR  is an Independent Production Company/PR Firm based in Los Angeles, Ca, Independently producing Live/Stage Events, Talent Showcases, Shorts,TV and Film projects and other media from 1998-Present. 
Meek Entertainment & PR's mission is to tell compelling stories that Empower, Educate, and Entertain you about forgiveness, love, redemption and family and leave the audience with a positive message whether the project be Faith-based or a Universal theme. Our slate of projects include: Live Event Production and PR, Webisodes, Reality TV, Situational Comedies, Sketch Comedy, Stageplays (Dramedies), Feature Films, Books, and Music. 
Vision
Meek Entertainment & PR was derived from it's creator's name...(Tymeka with Meek for short) created in 1998 with the scripture in mind -"Blessed are the Meek for they Shall Inherit The Earth." Matthew 5:5
The Founder/CEO of Meek Entertainment & PR- Tymeka "Meek" Coney's vision is to inspire and excel others lives mentally, emotionally and spiritually through creativity. She would like to create jobs through all of the projects that she has created and developed as well as continue to form partnerships with other entities to help bring their visions to life through Writing/Production.
Meek Entertainment & PR  has created/hosted several
successful events that were well-attended.

& PR hosted The 1st Annual Delta Sigma Theta Homecoming Talent Showcase

local artists competing in a Talent Show at Texas Tech University-Lubbock, Texas.

Motown" where they had several local artists dress up as Motown legends,

held at Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas.

showcase local poets in a competition for 1st place.

University, Lubbock, Texas.

to produce the short film Mahoghany Blues created as a vehicle to sale
the feature film Mahoghany Blues.

& PR

Urbanwear Curvie Couture" Fashion show held at The Celebrity Centre
International.

story:
Set in a Greenwich Village Cabaret, "Here I Am" is a story about friends surviving life's challenges after "coming out"


FROM SUBTLE DISCRIMINATION TO OUTRIGHT VIOLENCE.

The Cabaret is a Safe Place where they gather, share their lives, have fun and entertain through song and dance.

But even this Sanctuary is not immune.

Ultimately they must confront the consequences of this violence and decide how they will live and love in the face of intolerance.

"HERE I AM" is about finding a place you can call "HOME"

Where you can love...unconditionally,  no matter who you are or who you choose to be.

"HERE I AM  will both entertain and touch your heart.

I am  asking for your financial support to bring this all to often...true to life ...story to the stage.

I have assembled a production team.

Michael Joseph Ormond will direct.

Ted Arthur is the musical director.

Book and Score are complete.

Key Roles have been cast.

THE PRICE TAG TO PRODUCE "HERE I AM" IN AN INTIMATE OFF BROADWAY THEATER IN MANHATTAN IS 

$125,000

PLEASE MAKE YOUR TAX DEDUCTIBLE DONATION TODAY.

I THANK YOU FOR ANY AMOUNT YOU CAN PROVIDE.

HELP US BRING "HERE I AM" TO LIFE!

 

THANKS!

story:
UPDATE 2: We have surpassed our goal by over $7,300, for a total of $27,732! Visit the official Claudia Schreier Choreography Fractured Atlas fundraising page  to view the total amount raised in conjunction with our Indiegogo campaign. An enormous thank you to all who made this event possible.

UPDATE 1: In recognition of the extraordinary contributions and sacrifices made by the dancers, musicians, composers and other talented individuals supporting this event, an angel donor is matching all donations, dollar for dollar, that are made from now until total contributions equal the goal set of $20,000. Your contribution, in any amount, will be doubled thanks to this generous and ardent supporter. Please help us reach our goal, and watch your contribution be matched soon after it is made!


On August 8th & 9th, 2015, choreographer Claudia Schreier brought together some of today’s most celebrated professional dancers, composers and musicians for a performance in New York City featuring a full evening of her own work.

"The evening was an unalloyed triumph for all concerned...The performance ended with a colossal standing ovation and a din of cheers; the enthusiasm poured out into the lobby where the audience seemed reluctant to take leave after such an extraordinary evening. Although I have been following Claudia Schreier's work for a few seasons, I must say that experiencing a full programme of her choreography surpassed my expectations, which were very high indeed. In addition to her enviable ability to choose just the right music and fill it with meaningful movement, her work is blessedly free of gimmicks or self-indulgence. Claudia knows the value of not over-extending her ideas, so that after each piece we are left wanting more." —Oberon's Grove (read the full review)


WHAT IS CLAUDIA SCHREIER & COMPANY?

CS&C — originally a one-night-only event that extended to two  performances due to overwhelming demand — was a year in the making, featuring dancers from companies including New York City Ballet, American Ballet Theatre, and Dance Theatre of Harlem and world-class composers and artists.

The performance featured five ballets choreographed by Ms. Schreier, including 3 world premieres:

Almost Morning, set to an original score composed for Ms. Schreier by multi-Emmy Award winning composer Jeff Beal (House of Cards) and performed by a live piano & string quartet

Vigil, a pas de deux to sacred choral music by Tomás Luis de Victoria and Sergei Rachmaninoff and performed surrounded onstage by 20-member choir Tapestry

Pulse, a driving full-company work set to Dutch composer Douwe Eisenga's electrifying Piano Concerto: I.

The performance also featured new productions of Anomie, a 2010 ACDFA Gala Selection, and Harmonic, winner of the 2014 Breaking Glass Project, set to another thrilling score by Mr. Eisenga.


WHO IS INVOLVED?

Claudia Schreier & Company Dancers include:

Daniel Applebaum, New York City Ballet
Da'Von Doane, Dance Theatre of Harlem
Kaitlyn Gilliland, formerly of New York City Ballet
Drew Grant, Atlantic Ballet Theatre of Canada
Elinor Hitt, The Suzanne Farrell Ballet
Lauren King, New York City Ballet
Francis Lawrence, Dance Theatre of Harlem
Nayara Lopes, Dance Theatre of Harlem
Amber Neff, The Suzanne Farrell Ballet
Elizabeth Claire Walker, Los Angeles Ballet
Craig Wasserman, Pennsylvania Ballet
Lydia Wellington, New York City Ballet
Stephanie Williams, American Ballet Theatre

Special thanks to Meaghan Dutton-O'Hara and Claire Kretzschmar of New York City Ballet and Nadezhda Vostrikov of Intermezzo Dance Company for their participation in the project.

Lighting Designer: Brandon Stirling Baker
Production & Stage Manager: Courtney Pyke

Critically acclaimed for her “instinctive gift for movement and musicality” (Oberon’s Grove) and her “exquisite,” “complex, compelling, and absolutely stunning” works (Harvard Crimson), Claudia Schreier “inverts ballet norms” (Columbia Spectator) with a distinctive choreographic voice that fuses neoclassical technique with an inventive contemporary vocabulary.


WHY SHOULD I HELP?

Your support is essential in supporting these artists far beyond the final step.

Claudia is personally responsible for all costs (excluding theater rental, which has been generously provided by The Breaking Glass Project) and does not receive any of the proceeds from ticket sales. 
All contributions are used to defray costs which include, but are not limited to:

  • Dancer compensation
  • Musician compensation
  • Studio rental expenses
  • Music commissioning and copying fees
  • Costume expenses
  • Lighting design fees
  • Production fees
  • Travel costs
  • Publicity and marketing costs
  • Videographer and film equipment rental fees
  • Labor expenses
     ...and much more

Please lend a hand to ensure this unprecedented event will come to fruition. Don't forget that your donation is tax-deductible!


HOW WILL I IMPACT THIS PROJECT?

The value of this performance reaches far beyond the performance weekend. Through interdisciplinary collaboration with artists at the top of their fields who seek new opportunities for creative and technical development, this project serves as a springboard for both the choreographer and all others involved to take creative risks on a larger scale.

Almost Morning, set to an original score composed for Ms. Schreier by multi-Emmy Award winning composer Jeff Beal (House of Cards) and performed by a live piano & string quartetVigil, a pas de deux to sacred choral music by Tomás Luis de Victoria and Sergei Rachmaninoff and performed surrounded onstage by 20-member choir TapestryPulse, a driving full-company work set to Dutch composer Douwe Eisenga's electrifying Piano Concerto: I.The performance also featured new productions of Anomie, a 2010 ACDFA Gala Selection, and Harmonic, winner of the 2014 Breaking Glass Project, set to another thrilling score by Mr. Eisenga.



WHO IS INVOLVED?Claudia Schreier & Company Dancers include:
Daniel Applebaum, New York City BalletDa'Von Doane, Dance Theatre of HarlemKaitlyn Gilliland, formerly of New York City BalletDrew Grant, Atlantic Ballet Theatre of CanadaElinor Hitt, The Suzanne Farrell BalletLauren King, New York City BalletFrancis Lawrence, Dance Theatre of HarlemNayara Lopes, Dance Theatre of HarlemAmber Neff, The Suzanne Farrell BalletElizabeth Claire Walker, Los Angeles BalletCraig Wasserman, Pennsylvania BalletLydia Wellington, New York City BalletStephanie Williams, American Ballet TheatreSpecial thanks to Meaghan Dutton-O'Hara and Claire Kretzschmar of New York City Ballet and Nadezhda Vostrikov of Intermezzo Dance Company for their participation in the project.Lighting Designer: Brandon Stirling BakerProduction & Stage Manager: Courtney Pyke
Critically acclaimed for her “instinctive gift for movement and musicality” (Oberon’s Grove) and her “exquisite,” “complex, compelling, and absolutely stunning” works (Harvard Crimson), Claudia Schreier “inverts ballet norms” (Columbia Spectator) with a distinctive choreographic voice that fuses neoclassical technique with an inventive contemporary vocabulary.






WHY SHOULD I HELP?
Your support is essential in supporting these artists far beyond the final step.Claudia is personally responsible for all costs (excluding theater rental, which has been generously provided by The Breaking Glass Project) and does not receive any of the proceeds from ticket sales. 

All contributions are used to defray costs which include, but are not limited to:

Dancer compensation

Musician compensation

Studio rental expenses


Music commissioning and copying fees

Costume expenses

Lighting design fees


Production fees


Travel costs

Publicity and marketing costs
Videographer and film equipment rental fees

Labor expenses



     ...and much morePlease lend a hand to ensure this unprecedented event will come to fruition. Don't forget that your donation is tax-deductible!




HOW WILL I IMPACT THIS PROJECT?The value of this performance reaches far beyond the performance weekend. Through interdisciplinary collaboration with artists at the top of their fields who seek new opportunities for creative and technical development, this project serves as a springboard for both the choreographer and all others involved to take creative risks on a larger scale.

story:
ARTBARN

ARTBARN creates site-specific, immersive performance events. We love making experiences that are part theatre, part installation, part walking tour, and part meal. We've done it for the past two years. And this summer, we are doing it AGAIN!

With your help, we'll bring together a team of over 13 theatre-makers (actors, designers, writers, directors, chefs) to live, collaborate, and create together for two weeks. The end result is a weekend of performances in New York's Hudson Valley.

Year after year, we crafted stories that move audience through imaginative spaces. Instead of filing into a theatre and taking a seat in the darkness, audiences weave their way through forests, grand rooms, narrow hallways, and creaky staircases, sometimes peaking through hazy windows or through wooden balusters. We follow characters as their stories unfold while sharing in food and drink along the way. 

What We Need

Our $13,000 budget covers all aspects of bringing our team together, producing the piece, paying our artists, and getting the word out. 

This year we're growing our cast size, expanding our artistic & design intern team, and upping our number of performances. Our budget this year supports this exciting growth. 


When you make a donation of $30 or more, you'll get one or more tickets to this summer's ARTBARN performance. We'd love to see you there!

Our Track Record

We have a successful track record with projects like this. This is our team's third ARTBARN. At last year's piece -- This is a Ghost House -- we maxed out the number of audience members the space could hold and almost had to turn people away! 


Our Team 

The ARTBARN creative team brings together theatre-makers with a wealth and diversity of experience. 

Jess K Smith: ARTBARN Co-Artistic Director
Jess is a freelance director and an Assistant Professor of Theatre Arts at the University of Puget Sound. She focuses on generative work, adaptations, interdisciplinary collaborations, and imaginative interpretations of classic texts.

Melissa Brown: ARTBARN Co-Artistic Director
Melissa is a performer, writer, director, storyteller, collaborator and theatre maker. She is faculty at CUNY: BCC and a teaching artist at B.A.M. (Brooklyn Academy of Music), The Shakespeare Society, and the storytelling organization, The Moth. 

Deb O: ARTBARN Co-Artistic Director
Deb is on the Design Faculty of NYU Tisch’s Playwrights Horizons Theater School, teaches collaboration for the Brown University/Trinity Rep MFA Program, and has given master classes at Marquette, Fairmont University and Meredith College. She has received numerous American College Theater Festival Awards including Best Designer of the Year.

Kate Baker Linsley: ARTBARN Chef
Kate is a freelance chef in Denver. She grew up cooking alongside her parents, had her first apprenticeship at a Buddhist retreat center in southern France, and her second on a tall ship sailing around the Caribbean. She loves most to cook for family and friends, but has enjoyed the thrilling spectacle of cooking for 1,500 people, too. 

Alex Peterson: ARTBARN Development Director
Alex is a communications and marketing professional with more than a decade's worth of experience in the nonprofit field. She is the Marketing Coordinator at the Media Education Foundation, a nonprofit organization based in Northampton, Massachusetts that produces and distributes educational documentary films.

story:
What WDMC and Queens Shakespeare Are Up To Now

Following up our successful run of The Terrible Tragedy of Peter Pan and King Lear, Queens Shakespeare and What Dreams May Co are pleased to present Larry Blamire’s Robin Hood. Join us for a summer of shield maidens, sheriffs, princes and a prince among thieves…Oh and did we mention swords. Lots and lots of swords.

Director Christina Sheehan’s fantasy inspired design transports audiences to an England at war with itself, gallivanting through a Sherwood Forest that serves as the dual playground battlefield where Robin and his Merry Men defy tyranny.  This sprawling, action-packed retelling of the Robin Hood story gives us characters that challenge and reinvent the myth including a Maid Marian with a sword who can do her own saving, a female Little John who is as quick witted as she is quick with her quarter staff, and several other cross-gendered casting scenarios which elevate the stakes of both the conflict and the comedy in a script by Larry Blamire that walks the line between The Adventures of Robin Hood and Robin Hood: Men in Tights. Together these characters will stand against the power of King John and the Sheriff of Nottingham.

Through this lens we will explore what it means to “fight cruelty where you find it”, that “Even the smallest light shines in the darkness.”, and that those who “can stand up, will stand up.” “We’re not one, we’re many. When heroes stand together…work together, not a power in all of England can stop us.” 

Why Do We Need Your Help?

We are performing right in the heart of Times Square!  We are so excited to be producing at John DeSotelle Studio this winter!  Now that our rent is going up, any help you can give will be felt even more deeply.  Here's a breakdown of what you can do:

If you donate $90 you will be covering the price of a week of rehearsals.

If you donate $150 you will be covering the price of our programs.

If you donate $200 you will be covering the price of our photographer.

If you donate $500 you will be covering the rights to perform the play.

If you donate $1000 you will cover half a weekend of performances.

If you donate $2000 you will cover a full weekend of performances.

A contribution of any size will help us to make things happen, and makes you a part of the artistic process! So choose your favorite perk and join the team!

Who Is WDMC?

Founded in 2011, What Dreams May Co. is dedicated to making the classics accessible to all. We believe that the beauty of the language and the deeply human themes that Shakespeare used are still entirely relevant today. We remain true to these important foundations and use them to create a world audiences can recognize as their own, populated with characters that reflect the diverse community we live in. By holding the mirror up to the nature of our world as it is now, we can gain a deeper understanding of the words that have been handed down to us from centuries past.

Who Is Queens Shakespeare?

Founded in 2005 by Nanette Asher, Queens Shakespeare, Inc. is a not-for-profit professional theatrical company, which serves Queens County and the greater New York City area. Its aim is to act as a laboratory for actors of all ages and experience levels to explore classical works and to perform in fully produced, accessible, and innovative productions. Each season one production is developed as an educational tour which is then presented at different venues throughout the state. Producing and touring in this fashion allows the company to actively contribute to the growth and vibrancy of the developing Queens arts scene, while at the same time exposing classical works to modern audiences through the educational tour.

 

Your friends at WDMC and Queens Shakespeare,

Chrissy and Jonathan

story:
KEENERS! The BAKE SALE

 

  • HI! My name is William Burke and I make theatre in New York.  williamburke.net
  • I've been working on this piece for many years and finally have the chance to put part of it up.  The University settlement has been kind enough to give me a week to develop it and put up two performances.   Alaina Ferris has written the most stunning music.  The cast is ridiculous.  Inspired by a trip to the Lower East Side Tenement Museum, we will resurrect a group of female professional mourners from the late 1800s, and invite them into our lives to wail and keen for our inanimate and animated modern appliances.   Come pinpoint your grieving so that somehow and someday we may leave our burdens behind.  Lets breathe together in some sort of solidarity during these troubled times.  WE KEEN!  WE WAIL!  WE ARE PROFESSIONALS!
     
  • You are helping us with artist's fees and modest set pieces such as Christmas Lights and bowling balls.(Intrigued?).  This will be a bare bones but BOLD presentation in order to prepare for a full production next year.
  • In lieu of a traditional crowd sourcing endeavor we just want to throw a BAKE SALE!  KEENERS were mostly female groups of Irish Mourners who would mourn your loved ones in your home.  It was one of the few jobs a woman could have in the 1900's.  Bake Sales were one of the earliest examples of women starting theirown businesses and charities in America.  Mourning+Bake Sales= early signs of the power of the pervading female domination.
  • We are offering Irish Soda bread baked fresh in time for St. Patrick's day.  Blueberry Lemon Curd.  For the Bread.  Irish Ale brewed by The Premiere Bushwick  Brewing Club, The Bungholes.  You can buy separately or in a bundle. 
  • Any amount helps but we are hoping to reach $1000 in order to pay the artists and to make a cathartic and enlightening performance.  You can pick up your wares from William in Bushwick or at the Show on the 17th or 18th.  We will make special arrangement for delivery if neither of these options work for you. 

I try to make work that unifies and inspires reflection and action.  I have produced 5 shows since 2013 and each time I've reached success by walking or your shoulders.  Without your support I wouldn't be an artist.  Art can't be filled with empty promises.  Art can be realized in a bubble.  We can soldier on together.  With song, with bread, with Ale.  As Bread and Puppet states "Art is Food.  You can't eat it, but it feeds you"  Let's feed each other.  Let's get it. 

 

If you can't contribute or don't like baked goods or "Special" concoctions:

  • Please buy a ticket and come see what we're doing.  http://keeners.brownpapertickets.com/
  • Let people know about us. 
  • SEE YOU SOON!

story:
The recently created Long Island-based Tomorrow’s Classics Theatre Company (TCTC) is dedicated to solely producing cutting-edge new works.  Co-Founders, Debi Toni, a singer/songwriter, performer, teacher, and musical director; and Cindi Sansone-Braff, an award-winning playwright, director, author, entertainer, and psychic, truly believe that these innovative new plays are destined to become future theatre classics.

Their first project, Beethoven's Promethean Concerto in C Minor WoO, written by co-founder, Cindi Sansone-Braff, brings to the south shore suburbs of Long Island the kind of groundbreaking theatre that you’d only expect to find in London, Vienna, or New York City. 

Following Aristotle’s principles of three unities, this Four Movement music drama takes place on August 6,1826, the fateful day when Beethoven's beloved nephew shot himself in the head. Beethoven, forced to review the soul record of his life, ponders the universal question that has plagued him, Hamlet, and all of humankind since the dawn of time: "To be or not to be?"  Yes, for any soul-searching being, this is always the question.

Your contribution will help us commemorate, on August 5, 2017, the 191st Anniversary Eve of that earth-shattering day.  An Anniversary encore performance will take place on, Sunday, August 6, 2017.  By the way, these synchronistic dates were not picked by human design, but were divinely-timed by the powers that be -- stunning both co-founders!

After the Saturday night World Premiere performance, there will be an informative question-and-answer session. 

Why Was This Play Created in the First Place?

Cindi wrote this play after seeing the movie Immortal Beloved.  Although she had been a working psychic/medium for years, she'd never had the experience of having any famous deceased person channel thorough her.  All through the movie she kept getting messages from the Other Side telling her things like, “They tampered with facts.”  “This isn't true.  You can look it up for yourself.” She soon realized that the messages were coming from Beethoven himself. Yes, she was awestruck, since she knew very little about the man or even about his music, and she had no idea why he would come to her or what he wanted her to do with this information. This was back  1995, and Cindi wasn't computer literate, and she couldn't just go and Google the facts.  She had to peruse through a pile of books written about Beethoven to fact-check -- and lo and behold, she learned that there was a great deal of tampering with the facts concerning Beethoven's life throughout this movie. She also discovered that Beethoven was greatly concerned that his biographers would not tell the truth about his life.  It was his heartfelt desire that whatever might be written about him and his life, must be written with an absolute adherence to facts and truth, even if these truths might cast a dark shadow upon other people or even upon himself. Beethoven just wanted anyone who wrote anything about him to just tell the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth about him, and this is what Cindi has tried to do.  She also had to fill in the dots, as well as connect many dots, to figure out some of the more “mysterious” aspects of his life.

The overwhelming majority of his biographers have been men and they have failed to adequately understand the drama and trauma of his childhood and early life, and how these events came to  influence his music and his actions.  Cindi has succeeded in her efforts to bring a deep understanding of the heart and soul of this musical genius to the stage.

By becoming one of our Angel's you can help Beethoven's dying wish --  to have someone tell the truth of his existence --  come true.  Beethoven was a great fan of the Greek classical plays, and Cindi believes that he would be pleased with her decision to follow Aristotle’s principles of three unities in Beethoven’s Promethean Concerto in C Minor WoO and to incorporate a Greek Chorus to help tell the story of his life. 

Furthermore, your generous contribution can help us make this a first-rate theatrical production: a worthy tribute to the man, the myth, the music. 

Our greatest hope is that this scaled-down production can be a vehicle that will generate interest from potential producers, theatres, or other theatre professionals who believe in this play and who will want to see it have a fully-realized production in the near future.

What We Need

The $3500.00 will help us pay for the scoring of the music.  This is an arduous task since most of the musical pieces being used in this production need to be scored down for a solo piano.  For example: segments of the 3rd, 5th, 6th, 7th, and 9th symphonies are used throughout the play.  Beethoven’s mass Missa Solemnis and his opera Fidelio are also featured.  The funds will help pay for the two dozen musical scores needed for us to complete this project.

We also need to pay for the rental of The Bacca Arts Center for rehearsal use and for the actual performances.

We need funds to help with the set which takes place on the hilltop site known as the ruins of Rauhenstein in the quiet Helenenthal production. We need to recreate a forest scene with some ruins and a bench.

The funds would also help with the costumes involved.  Beethoven needs 19th century attire: a top hat, long black coat, trousers, jacket, vest, white shirt, scarf.  We also need a Beethoven wig and a cane. The chorus members need Greek tunics that can transform into Egyptian robes.  Josephine needs a 19th century long white gown.  There is also an Egyptian dancer who needs a tunic, wig, headpiece, and gold wings.  Karl needs a period appropriate suit of clothes as well.

The actors portraying Beethoven and his nephew, Karl, as well as the chorus members will all receive a stipend, and your contribution will help us with this cost.

The funds will also compensate the pianist and musical director.

A stipend will be given to the three violinists.

The funds will go to pay the technical crew and the stagehands.

The funds will also help with all the properties we need for the play.

The funds will further help with the sound, lighting, and all things technical necessary to stage this production.

Funds will also go to cover the cost of the program and flyers.

For your contribution we have reserved seats, a commemorative poster, and your name will appear in our program. 

                                                      Our ProductionTeam

CO-Founder, Co-Producer, Musical Director, Narrator

Debi Toni has been professionally involved in theatre since 1985 from production to performance. In 2000, she began creating custom made shows for her students of Debi Toni Music Studios, LLC performing alongside of them. Creating theatrical experiences for students of all ages and talent has become another specialty, so it is fitting to be a co-founder of the Tomorrow’s Classics Theatre Company.  It’s an honor to be sharing the story of a man who affected a world beyond his own incredible imagination to alter the course of history.  Ms. Toni earned a Master’s Degree in Music.  Currently, Debi Toni is a member of the Babylon Chorale, a Cantor at Our Lady of Lourdes Church (Massapequa Park), a writer and a composer.  Her piano and sight singing music books will be available for purchase in the near future. www.debitoni.com.

www.debitonimusicstudios.com     

Co-Founder, Co-Producer, Playwright, Stage Manager, Director, Actor

Cindi Sansone Braff is perhaps best known for being one of Long Island’s top psychic/mediums. She's also an award-winning playwright, dancer, entertainer, and the author of two self-help relationship books: Grant Me a Higher Love and Why Good People Can’t Leave Bad Relationships. Cindi used all of her diverse talents to create Beethoven’s Promethean Concerto in C Minor Wo0.  Over a four-year period, she researched, wrote, and most importantly -- channeled Beethoven himself -- to create this theatrical masterpiece. www.grantmeahigherlove.com.

Musical Scoring

Nicholas Yandell is a Portland-based composer seeking to create the 21st century in musical art by capturing every aspect of post-millennial life we experience, past, present and future, and concoct it all into a formula of organized sound.  He loves to grab hold of the passion, pain, affection, spirituality, joy, incompleteness, anger, regret, sadness, yearning we all feel and to process it all aurally. He aspires to find those sounds that dwell in the wordless void, that amalgamate with the atmosphere and enrich it, that descend from the skyscrapers and crawl out of the cracks in the sidewalk to soothe, agitate, impassion, drive, flow through our veins, and make us feel alive! These desires tend to manifest themselves into classical concert works, film scores, post-rock songs, and electronic music, sometimes amalgamating with fiction and poetry into meshes of lyrics, stories, and sound.

Actor: Beethoven

Michael Brinzer is a multi-instrumentalist based in New York City. As a Lindenhurst native, Michael began refining his artistic talents as a child.  It was at Lindenhurst High School that he started to develop a passion for playing multiple woodwind instruments. This was also when he was introduced to acting and theatre.  His is grateful for any opportunity he gets to incorporate both music and theatre into his life, and portraying Beethoven certainly allows him to do this. He currently studies Saxophone Performance at the Manhattan School of Music with Dr. Paul Cohen.  To learn more about him, visit his website at: michaelbrinzer.com

...Your Perks

Our Angels  (All the Posters Can Be Autographed by Cast and Crew if You’d Like)

Seraphim

$200: 4 VIP reserved seats, 4 commemorative posters, and mention in program as a Seraphim.

Cherubim

$ 100: 2 VIP reserved seats and 2 commemorative posters, and mention in program as a Cherubim.

Thrones

$75: 1 ticket for a VIP reserved seat, a poster, and mention in program as Thrones.

Dominions

$50: 1 ticket, a poster, and mention in program as Dominions.

Virtues

$25: You will receive a poster and mention in program as Virtues.

Just a $10.00 donation gets you a raffle ticket where you can win a gift certificate for an hour long psychic/medium reading with Cindi. Cindi was named Best Psychic five years in a row by the Long Island Press, featured in Reader’s Digest as a psychic/medium, recommended by Newsday as one of the best psychic/mediums on Long Island, featured in the Daily News and Cablevision’s Neighborhood Journal.  

Any and all donations appreciated.  People donating sums above and beyond $200 will receive the key to our hearts and be mentioned in our program as: Archangels.

Posters to be picked up at show.

What will you offer people who contribute, but who can not attend the performance?

Our Seraphims and Cherubims will get an autographed copy of the manuscript, their names in our program, an autographed copy of the program, and commemorative posters. Our Thrones, Dominions, and Virtues will receive their names in the programs, a copy of the program, and a commemorative poster.  We will mail these items out to you.

Can't Help Out With Cold Cash?  No Worries -- You Can Still Help!

Some people just can't contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

We'd love it if you would help us spread the word about our project.  Share it on your Social Media sites, and “Like” us on ours: https://www.facebook.com/BeethovensPrometheanConcerto/

You can also help us out, by coming to the showing on August 5 and 6 at the Bacca Arts Center, 149 N. Wellwood Avenue, Lindenhurst, NY.

 For ticket information go to : BrownPaperTickets.com or call: 1-800-838-3006.

If you are looking to get involved with Tomorrow's Classic Theatre Company, email us at: cindisansonebraff@gmail.com and we'll put you to work.  For this particular play, we could use a few stagehands and others to help out with the running of the show.  If you're interested, shoot us an email!
story_txt: The recently created Long Island-based Tomorrow’s Classics Theatre Company (TCTC) is dedicated to solely producing cutting-edge new works.  Co-Founders, Debi Toni, a singer/songwriter, performer, teacher, and musical director; and Cindi Sansone-Braff, an award-winning playwright, director, author, entertainer, and psychic, truly believe that these innovative new plays are destined to become future theatre classics.Their first project, Beethoven's Promethean Concerto in C Minor WoO, written by co-founder, Cindi Sansone-Braff, brings to the south shore suburbs of Long Island the kind of groundbreaking theatre that you’d only expect to find in London, Vienna, or New York City. Following Aristotle’s principles of three unities, this Four Movement music drama takes place on August 6,1826, the fateful day when Beethoven's beloved nephew shot himself in the head. Beethoven, forced to review the soul record of his life, ponders the universal question that has plagued him, Hamlet, and all of humankind since the dawn of time: "To be or not to be?"  Yes, for any soul-searching being, this is always the question.Your contribution will help us commemorate, on August 5, 2017, the 191st Anniversary Eve of that earth-shattering day.  An Anniversary encore performance will take place on, Sunday, August 6, 2017.  By the way, these synchronistic dates were not picked by human design, but were divinely-timed by the powers that be -- stunning both co-founders!After the Saturday night World Premiere performance, there will be an informative question-and-answer session. Why Was This Play Created in the First Place?Cindi wrote this play after seeing the movie Immortal Beloved.  Although she had been a working psychic/medium for years, she'd never had the experience of having any famous deceased person channel thorough her.  All through the movie she kept getting messages from the Other Side telling her things like, “They tampered with facts.”  “This isn't true.  You can look it up for yourself.” She soon realized that the messages were coming from Beethoven himself. Yes, she was awestruck, since she knew very little about the man or even about his music, and she had no idea why he would come to her or what he wanted her to do with this information. This was back  1995, and Cindi wasn't computer literate, and she couldn't just go and Google the facts.  She had to peruse through a pile of books written about Beethoven to fact-check -- and lo and behold, she learned that there was a great deal of tampering with the facts concerning Beethoven's life throughout this movie. She also discovered that Beethoven was greatly concerned that his biographers would not tell the truth about his life.  It was his heartfelt desire that whatever might be written about him and his life, must be written with an absolute adherence to facts and truth, even if these truths might cast a dark shadow upon other people or even upon himself. Beethoven just wanted anyone who wrote anything about him to just tell the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth about him, and this is what Cindi has tried to do.  She also had to fill in the dots, as well as connect many dots, to figure out some of the more “mysterious” aspects of his life.The overwhelming majority of his biographers have been men and they have failed to adequately understand the drama and trauma of his childhood and early life, and how these events came to  influence his music and his actions.  Cindi has succeeded in her efforts to bring a deep understanding of the heart and soul of this musical genius to the stage.By becoming one of our Angel's you can help Beethoven's dying wish --  to have someone tell the truth of his existence --  come true.  Beethoven was a great fan of the Greek classical plays, and Cindi believes that he would be pleased with her decision to follow Aristotle’s principles of three unities in Beethoven’s Promethean Concerto in C Minor WoO and to incorporate a Greek Chorus to help tell the story of his life. Furthermore, your generous contribution can help us make this a first-rate theatrical production: a worthy tribute to the man, the myth, the music. Our greatest hope is that this scaled-down production can be a vehicle that will generate interest from potential producers, theatres, or other theatre professionals who believe in this play and who will want to see it have a fully-realized production in the near future.What We NeedThe $3500.00 will help us pay for the scoring of the music.  This is an arduous task since most of the musical pieces being used in this production need to be scored down for a solo piano.  For example: segments of the 3rd, 5th, 6th, 7th, and 9th symphonies are used throughout the play.  Beethoven’s mass Missa Solemnis and his opera Fidelio are also featured.  The funds will help pay for the two dozen musical scores needed for us to complete this project.We also need to pay for the rental of The Bacca Arts Center for rehearsal use and for the actual performances.We need funds to help with the set which takes place on the hilltop site known as the ruins of Rauhenstein in the quiet Helenenthal production. We need to recreate a forest scene with some ruins and a bench.The funds would also help with the costumes involved.  Beethoven needs 19th century attire: a top hat, long black coat, trousers, jacket, vest, white shirt, scarf.  We also need a Beethoven wig and a cane. The chorus members need Greek tunics that can transform into Egyptian robes.  Josephine needs a 19th century long white gown.  There is also an Egyptian dancer who needs a tunic, wig, headpiece, and gold wings.  Karl needs a period appropriate suit of clothes as well.The actors portraying Beethoven and his nephew, Karl, as well as the chorus members will all receive a stipend, and your contribution will help us with this cost.The funds will also compensate the pianist and musical director.A stipend will be given to the three violinists.The funds will go to pay the technical crew and the stagehands.The funds will also help with all the properties we need for the play.The funds will further help with the sound, lighting, and all things technical necessary to stage this production.Funds will also go to cover the cost of the program and flyers.For your contribution we have reserved seats, a commemorative poster, and your name will appear in our program.                                                       Our ProductionTeamCO-Founder, Co-Producer, Musical Director, NarratorDebi Toni has been professionally involved in theatre since 1985 from production to performance. In 2000, she began creating custom made shows for her students of Debi Toni Music Studios, LLC performing alongside of them. Creating theatrical experiences for students of all ages and talent has become another specialty, so it is fitting to be a co-founder of the Tomorrow’s Classics Theatre Company.  It’s an honor to be sharing the story of a man who affected a world beyond his own incredible imagination to alter the course of history.  Ms. Toni earned a Master’s Degree in Music.  Currently, Debi Toni is a member of the Babylon Chorale, a Cantor at Our Lady of Lourdes Church (Massapequa Park), a writer and a composer.  Her piano and sight singing music books will be available for purchase in the near future. www.debitoni.com.www.debitonimusicstudios.com     Co-Founder, Co-Producer, Playwright, Stage Manager, Director, ActorCindi Sansone Braff is perhaps best known for being one of Long Island’s top psychic/mediums. She's also an award-winning playwright, dancer, entertainer, and the author of two self-help relationship books: Grant Me a Higher Love and Why Good People Can’t Leave Bad Relationships. Cindi used all of her diverse talents to create Beethoven’s Promethean Concerto in C Minor Wo0.  Over a four-year period, she researched, wrote, and most importantly -- channeled Beethoven himself -- to create this theatrical masterpiece. www.grantmeahigherlove.com.Musical ScoringNicholas Yandell is a Portland-based composer seeking to create the 21st century in musical art by capturing every aspect of post-millennial life we experience, past, present and future, and concoct it all into a formula of organized sound.  He loves to grab hold of the passion, pain, affection, spirituality, joy, incompleteness, anger, regret, sadness, yearning we all feel and to process it all aurally. He aspires to find those sounds that dwell in the wordless void, that amalgamate with the atmosphere and enrich it, that descend from the skyscrapers and crawl out of the cracks in the sidewalk to soothe, agitate, impassion, drive, flow through our veins, and make us feel alive! These desires tend to manifest themselves into classical concert works, film scores, post-rock songs, and electronic music, sometimes amalgamating with fiction and poetry into meshes of lyrics, stories, and sound.Actor: BeethovenMichael Brinzer is a multi-instrumentalist based in New York City. As a Lindenhurst native, Michael began refining his artistic talents as a child.  It was at Lindenhurst High School that he started to develop a passion for playing multiple woodwind instruments. This was also when he was introduced to acting and theatre.  His is grateful for any opportunity he gets to incorporate both music and theatre into his life, and portraying Beethoven certainly allows him to do this. He currently studies Saxophone Performance at the Manhattan School of Music with Dr. Paul Cohen.  To learn more about him, visit his website at: michaelbrinzer.com...Your PerksOur Angels  (All the Posters Can Be Autographed by Cast and Crew if You’d Like)Seraphim$200: 4 VIP reserved seats, 4 commemorative posters, and mention in program as a Seraphim.Cherubim$ 100: 2 VIP reserved seats and 2 commemorative posters, and mention in program as a Cherubim.Thrones$75: 1 ticket for a VIP reserved seat, a poster, and mention in program as Thrones.Dominions$50: 1 ticket, a poster, and mention in program as Dominions.Virtues$25: You will receive a poster and mention in program as Virtues.Just a $10.00 donation gets you a raffle ticket where you can win a gift certificate for an hour long psychic/medium reading with Cindi. Cindi was named Best Psychic five years in a row by the Long Island Press, featured in Reader’s Digest as a psychic/medium, recommended by Newsday as one of the best psychic/mediums on Long Island, featured in the Daily News and Cablevision’s Neighborhood Journal.  Any and all donations appreciated.  People donating sums above and beyond $200 will receive the key to our hearts and be mentioned in our program as: Archangels.Posters to be picked up at show.What will you offer people who contribute, but who can not attend the performance? Our Seraphims and Cherubims will get an autographed copy of the manuscript, their names in our program, an autographed copy of the program, and commemorative posters. Our Thrones, Dominions, and Virtues will receive their names in the programs, a copy of the program, and a commemorative poster.  We will mail these items out to you.Can't Help Out With Cold Cash?  No Worries -- You Can Still Help!Some people just can't contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean they can't help!We'd love it if you would help us spread the word about our project.  Share it on your Social Media sites, and “Like” us on ours: https://www.facebook.com/BeethovensPrometheanConcerto/You can also help us out, by coming to the showing on August 5 and 6 at the Bacca Arts Center, 149 N. Wellwood Avenue, Lindenhurst, NY. For ticket information go to : BrownPaperTickets.com or call: 1-800-838-3006.If you are looking to get involved with Tomorrow's Classic Theatre Company, email us at: cindisansonebraff@gmail.com and we'll put you to work.  For this particular play, we could use a few stagehands and others to help out with the running of the show.  If you're interested, shoot us an email!

story:
UPDATE...LONDON THEATRE PRODUCER HAS COMMITED  £2000 ON REACHING 50% OF THE £41,000 BUDGET WITH OPTION TO DONATE MORE

Yes... that's me, Peter Shillingford, doffing the straw hat and banished to the garden shed to extol the brilliant virtues or lack of in "THE RUGGER BUGGERS BAWDY SONG FEST" my latest stage musical. A celebration of everything lyrical in the rugby world and beyond.

After 40 years behind the camera and sometimes in front, the high point being the Cinematographer/Line Producer on the Academy Award winning film "Genocide",  where I brought the $3 million dollar film in under budget.       Orson Welles did the voice over commentary brilliantly and donated his fee. Reading excerpts of letters from the concentration camp victims was a tearful Elizabeth Taylor. It was a real buzz to get thanked from the Academy Award stage by my Executive Producer Rabbi Marvin Hier.

                                                THE AGES OF MAN AND BOY

I have produced hundreds of commercials, financed 3 short films and lectured on IMAX production and my 25 years of motion pictures in Hollywood. I have been involved in film and video in over 40 countries.  

My stage musical is "THE RUGGER BUGGERS BAWDY SONG FEST," which I am sure will amuse you because I know you have a great sense of humour, You must have to get this far past the video clip and the photo's of the old boy.

Laughter is the driving force in my life; one gets it working with camera crews, actors and hanging out at rugby clubs for the choral delight of singing outrageous non-PC songs.  And yes, the beer and the laughter flowed and the ladies joined in for the gin and the sin.  

My stage show “THE RUGGER BUGGERS BAWDY SONG FEST” is backed by the glorious and inebriated voices of Ron and the Rude Boys Choir...twenty West Country pub lads in fine form.  Their voices combined with the antics of the actors and singers on stage will make for an outrageous evening. Audience participation will be encouraged physically and vocally with video monitors screening the lyrics for the many Karaoke singalong moments.

A GATHERING OF THE TROOPS ON THE FIRST “STAR WARS"

Peter Shillingford. Director/Camera on “The Making of Star Wars”

The production of my stage musical “The Rugger Buggers Bawdy Song Fest”, is a completed script or "book" in theatre parlance. It is based on the over 100 recorded songs I now have under licence. All are outrageous. The intent is a production of a 120 minute stage musical for global distribution and from which a DVD and a CD will be culled for global distribution at a later stage. 

Other distribution potentials are stage productions of foreign language versions, a motion picture and a late night television series.  The Karaoke market is another area of distribution along with short clips for phones and tablets. Each song is a separate segment of stage action and lyrics

With your help I can get the Rugger Buggers on the road.  The intent is an audience deep into honking laughter, snorting giggles, bellows from the belly and rollicking hysteria with tears in the eyes. 

AND...be assured that with the lyrics being very non-PC, an alternative clean version will be edited with an emission of my own personal sound effect of gas covering the vulgarities.

PLEASE consider a donation, however small. We are intent on bringing a great deal more laughter into all of our lives.

And thanks for reading this far. Here comes the most fun I have had to date. This is the CASTING BRIEF REQUIREMENT as placed in The Stage Magazine.

ACTORS required who can sing and dance with improve experience and certainly no shame.

MAJOR KOCKSUP. Master of Ceremonies. (revolving celebrity role)                     An Edwardian toff of the 1900’s music hall, ready with wit and mockery, very much in control at his podium, except when he is not. Often interrupts to add to or subdue the chaos on stage. Encourages audience participation, teases the cast, and instigates the abuse of the actors and hecklers.

MIKE HUNT.
Lecherous choir leader, a sexually repressed psychotic druggie.

JOCK STRAP.                                                                
A Mad Scot, high kicking chorus  girl in a short kilt with no knickers.

REGGIE MENTAL.                                                             
The Vicar. Flasher in a nun’s habit . Rock and roll queen.

IVOR BIGGAN.                                                              
Cross dresser with rubber sex dolls, male and female.

JACK SOFALOT.                                                              
Closet pervert groper, flamboyant self-abuse and voyeur tendencies.

CONNIE LINGUS.                                                            
Nymphomaniac opera singer with a major drink problem.

WAYNE KERR.                                                                
Pole dancer and stripper, post operation so now  she is the lovely Jenny Talia.

ANNA KEY.                                                                  
Punk rocker with a biker attitude.  Very capable with weapons.

JUSTIN YARMOUTH.                                                          
Head Master of a Nazi swingers club.  Collector of ancient dildos.

ACTORS! We are still casting so apply!...I am trying to keep you employed!

The STAGE SETTINGS are simple.  A rugby club bar, a sofa bed, two screens for costume changes, a few rugby pennants, a piano or a 4 piece quartet, 

Once THE RUGGER BUGGERS BAWDY SONG FEST is produced on stage and videoed, the DVD and CD of the show will be offered at a minimal cost to theatre groups, amateur and professional, nationwide and global, for ten or more actors to create their low cost production in village hall or city theatre. 

LAUGHTER is the essence of one's life and the production team, actors and our supporters intend to make the whole world a happier place.

Choose your gifts and then please forwarded the link to your family, friends and enemies for their participation and donations. It would help if you could encourage whoever receives the link to forward it to their friends and enemies for further donations.

My request to you is to donate and to enjoy your gifts, and many thanks.

I will be connecting with theatre groups worldwide as well as requesting participation from the over 2,000 rugby clubs in my data base. Other sports are being researched and will be contacted along with international agents, leagues and clubs. 

Rugby is alive and well in Wales, Scotland, Ireland, Italy, France, Australia, New Zealand, Fiji, South America and the Far East.  The USA has just formed state wide leagues for both men and women. All will be approached.

Editorial material will be submitted to sports mags and relevant media.

A children's charity will receive a percentage of any income I receive from this project.

THE BARE BONES BUDGET

Producer/writer Peter Shillingford                                               £0
Director 8 Weeks at £1000 per week.                                          £8,000
10 Actors 4 weeks at home with script and songs                   £0
10 Actors 4 weeks rehearsal at £200 a week                            £8,000
Rehearsal room  4 weeks at £100 a day 20 days                     £2,000
Theatre rent 2 days at £1000 a day                                              £2000
Camera cost 4 days at £3000 a day                                            £12,000
Edit cost 3 weeks at £2000 per week                                          £6,000
Transfers to CD’s and DVD’s allow                                                £1,000
Subsistence, travel, office                                                                £2,000 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

                                                                                                  TOTAL   £41,000

There you have it, join us on this quest for fun and laughter... and it will be an outrageous venture. Soon to be in a theater near you.

Thank you and I look forward to your participation in what I believe will be a very unique production, risque yes, humorous most certainly, and blessed with a great deal of laughter.

PLEASE donate and enjoy the gifts listed on the right of the page.

Many thanks.

Peter Shillingford

My cohorts / sidekicks keeping me straight and on course are:

David Shillingford   Media Guru        Emma Chisit   Accountant                                                                        

 Joy Shillingford   Mother Ship         Peter Shillingford   Creator 

                                   

Reg Starkey  Legal Wrangler       Tom (John) Jones  Impersonator
