After ten years insightful patience and observation  by my exceptional  trinity (masterminded by the good doctor ) an Occupational Therapist suggested that I join Workman Arts, a CAMH –based arts organization developed by Lisa Brown, a former psychiatric nurse.  I had extensive theatre training and performance experience ,before I jumped, but afterwards I no more expected to act again onstage than “fly to the moon”.   ( I guess now I am waiting for NASA to call me). 
Workman right away entrusted me with lead roles in productions, gave me excellent classes, and the privilege of studying Improv with Kate Ashby, who like myself. was a Second City alumnus,  and literally  the most amazing teacher I have ever worked with. I had had many superlative instructors in my youth. After a few years, and way before I thought I was able, she asked me to teach when she had time conflicts in her schedule.  I had taught extensively before, but of course did not dream that I ever would do that again, and certainly not that soon. Looking back I think it showed she had remarkable insight and intuition. Lisa had the brilliance to put me on the Board of Directors.  The Board reawakened and helped re-develope my organizational mind (I had run companies before ) with  kindness patience and respect.  Who would think someone could be so  gently nurtured and developed, in so many ways?
They say “it takes a village to raise a child”.  It takes a community to heal someone.  I live in Leslieville.  When I started to walk again, furniture stores would literally put out chairs so I could rest and then keep going.  People I didn’t really know would stop and say “You’re doing better today aren’t you?”  The Tango Palace Coffee shop across the street was my community centre.  I was treated with love and fun even when I was hypo-manic and crazier than a loon.  Stratenger’s Bar and Restaurant, our local “Cheers” where everyone knows our names, would be a respite for Janet and I now and then.  She would have a glass of wine, and I an iced tea, and we would with the help of friends, pretend everything was almost bearable for an hour or so.
Now it is no longer just bearable but fun and rewarding.  I am happily married to Janet and have my teaching and writing and performing chops back.  And as you see my life long friend and colleague Stephen LaFrenie and I are starting a company.  I don’t just “survive” I honestly feel that I thrive. No one heals alone in a room staring at the ceiling, yet that is the fate of many survivors.   I know the terrifying price of that condition.  Steve and I are starting MadPower to do our bit to see that someday no survivor is ever cast in that reality again. 
You could say “We have a dream”.
Listen to Miles talking about MadMPower -

 
What we need.
We are raising $15,000.00 to help cover the cost of the production, the vast majority of which will pay the actors and crew, in other words, the artists themselves. The play opens August 23, 2017 in Toronto at the Palmerston Library Theatre.  Rehearsals begin on July 24th.  
The Impact
The dream is to create a company that will integrate professional artists who are psychiatric survivors with other professionals.  Many doors can close when someone is diagnosed with a psychiatric illness or during the time of their recovery.  This recovery time and diagnosis should never prevent someone from fulfilling their dream in life.  Sometimes it does. MadMPower seeks to create a safe harbour for people preparing to return to, or begin, their professional career on the stage or as an artist.  This includes those dedicated professionals who work behind the scenes to make a production come to life. You can help us create this safe environment and by doing so reveal a world of wonderful artists who have important things to say and share with all of us.  Integration is the surest way to eradicate stigma. We ask you to help us achieve this goal.
Other Ways You Can HelpYou can help us by telling people about us.  Share this campaign with as many people as you can by using the Indiegogo share tools or email the link.  Come to the play in August this summer and meet us.  You can volunteer on the production, help us with research into other means of funding, follow us and share our twitter and facebook pages.  Volunteer on the production, help us research and organize future events.

story:
Who We Are

Elysium Conservatory Theatre (a 501 c(3) non-profit organization) grows fearless artistic expression within our community of emerging artists, company membership and resident teaching artists - all invested in each other's success.

ECT breeds artists with heart, who hunger to explore, to rehearse, to journey into the creative unknown and follow that lighting bolt of inspiration - whenever it strikes.

We believe art is about getting there vs. starting there. About falling in love with discovery, and nurturing the bravery of curiosity within the crafting of story and character. We seek playgrounds of wonder and exploration, and opportunities to ADVENTURE into artistic unknowns.

And to roar into it...Fearlessly.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The 2017 STARS of Elysium fundraising campaign seeks to broaden ECT's ability to grow fearless expression within our community and company.

OUR GOALS:  raise $3,000 while ...

  • INSPIRING the most, new contributors with our first ever 501 c(3) NON-PROFIT campaign!
  • EMPOWERING our efforts to positively affect our community through the arts.
  • CELEBRATING opportunities to grow ECT's performing arts education and performance.

 

The Impact

A successful 2017 STARS of Elysium campaign launches ECT forward with:

  • SCHOLARSHIPS for our most deserving, emerging artists.
  • FLOORING & LIGHTING for our dance studio.
  • RESTROOMS expansion and renovation.
  • MARQUEE materials.
  • Inspiration. Confidence. EMPOWERMENT.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The success of this project lies in the sense of community it inspires. We believe in the power of community. It is an ever increasing force, a will that can do things that no single person - no matter their talents - can achieve on their own. Put simply, we are Believers. Optimists. Enthusiasts. We invite you to share in our dream - that together we can build an artistic paradise of devoted, passionate, and FEARLESS artists, boldly pushing the boundaries of performance throughout the world!

story:
Its time to move! C'est le temps de bouger!

(Version française ensuite)

Three years ago, As I was studying at Ballet Divertimento (12 hours a week) in Montreal, I also finished a college degree in Visual-Arts (my second passion) at Cégep de Saint-Laurent.

And now that college is over it is time for me to audition for contemporary dance schools and follow workshops to deepen my technique and develop my creativity through movement, and really follow my dream!

To do so, I just need a hand! I've just been officially invited to PARTS dance school auditions in Brussels on April 2nd. Also, I will be participating in a three week dance workshop in Montreal called Transformation. Starting May 30th 2016, I will be studying with Josée Agudo, James O'hara and Kelly Keenan.

Therefore, I must raise 3000$ to reach my goal:
1000$: flight from Montreal to Brussels and Back
500$: my stay in Brussels from march 30th to april 10th (food and lodging) 1300$: To participate in the workshop Transformation in Montreal
200$: provisions during Transformation (3 weeks)

If my goal is not completely achieved the reached amount will help me paye the flight to Brussels in part at the least :). Any contribution, no matter how small can help and are truly appreciated!

Ideally, my aim through this dance journey is to deepen and share the body's expression with its infinite possibilities waiting to be discovered. Just like travelling through space to another country and meeting new cultures, we can travel through the body and meet ourselves in a different light. The body is wise... If we listen we can learn and most of all step out of our minds while still being aware. This phenomenon of learning from the body is something which the development is urgent and fundamental in this excessively pragmatic society seemingly unaware of its concerning lack of balance.

To participate in the PARTS audition and Transformation workshop would allow me to learn, to do more profound artistic research while also developing a more acute kinesthetic sens which is vital for all dancers and other movers.

Auditions are part of all dancers lives and every experience brings with it important lessons, all of them practical for the next step. Whatever the results, I will have the chance to meet other dancers and widen my network in the capital of contemporary dance!

Thank you for your contributions! You can also use the "sharing" tools on this indiegogo website to encourage me in my studies and artistic journey.

Thank you all very much! Camille Conarroe :) 

Il y a 3 ans maintenant, j'ai eu la chance d'étudier au Ballet Divertimento à Montréal. Le Cégep maintenant terminé, il est temps pour moi d'auditionner pour des écoles de danse contemporaine et de suivre des stages afin d'approfondir ma technique et mon sens artisique à travers le mouvement. Suivre mon rêve quoi!

Pour ce faire, j'ai besoin d'un petit coup de pouce! J'ai été invitée aux auditions de l'école de danse contemporaine PARTS en Belgique le 2 avril. De plus, je vais participer au stage de danse Transformation à Montréal du 30 mai au 17 juin pour étudier avec Josée Agudo, James O'hara et Kelly Keenan.  Je dois donc amasser 3000$ pour atteindre mon objectif.

1000$: Vol aller-retour Montréal, Belgique

500$: pour rester (logement et nourriture) à Bruxelle 1 semaine (si je suis acceptée à l'audition finale)

1300$: pour participer au stage Transformation à Montréal

200$: provisions pendant le stage Transformation

Si mon objectif n'est pas complètement atteint, la somme récoltée pourra tout de même m'aider à  payer mon billet d'avion à Bruxelle, du moins en partie :). Toutes contributions, aussi petites qu'elles soient seront énormément appréciées!

Tout en poursuivant des études en danse au Ballet Divertimento (jusqu'à 12 heures par semaine), j'ai terminé mon DEC en Arts-Plastiques (ma deuxième passion) au Cégep Saint-Laurent.

La Belgique reste aujourd'hui, le foyer de la danse contemporaine! C'est-à-dire que même si je ne suis pas sélectionnée pour les auditions finales à PARTS, j'aurais la chance de suivre des cours au pays pendant mon séjour!

Idéalement, mon but premier dans mon cheminement en danse est d'approfondir et de partager cette expression du corps que nous possédons tous. Faire la rencontre du corps et découvrir les possibilitées infinies qu'il nous offre est aussi enrichissant que de découvrir un nouveau pays, une nouvelle culture. Le corps est sage... Si on est à l'écoute, on apprend, et surtout on sort de sa tête en restant toutefois engagé, allumé. Selon moi, ce développement est fondamental dans une société excessivement pragmatique et déséquilibrée comme la nôtre.

Participer à PARTS et au stage Transformation me permettrait d'approfondir ma technique, de faire de la recherche artistique concentré et de développer un sens kinesthésique substantiel. 

Peu importe le résultat, auditionner fait partie de la vie d'un danseur et chaque expérience amène avec elle des leçons pratiques et enrichissantes pour la prochaine étape. De plus, j'aurais la chance de rencontrer d'autres danseurs et d'élargir mon réseaux à l'international, voir dans la capitale de la danse contemporaine!

 Merci de contribuer et d'utiliser les outils de partage sur le site, indiegogo, pour m'encourager dans ce projet d'étude et dans ma démarche artistique!

Merci infiniment! :)

Camille Conarroe

story:
Ο επαγγελματικός θίασος ReAct, με έδρα την Καλαμάτα, προσπαθεί να δημιουργήσει μια μόνιμη στέγη μετατρέποντας ένα παλιό νηπιαγωγείο σε θεατρική σκηνή.

Ο θίασος δημιουργήθηκε το 2015 από την Καλλιρρόη Βελέντζα, ηθοποιό, σκηνοθέτη και θεατρολόγο και αποτελείται από επαγγελματίες ηθοποιούς και χορευτές. Η κύρια ενασχόληση της ομάδας είναι η μελέτη κειμένων του νεοελληνικού θεάτρου, νέων κυρίως συγγραφέων, μέσω των κωδίκων του ψυχολογικού θεάτρου και του σύγχρονου χορού.

Σε μία πόλη φιλότεχνη και με έντονη καλλιτεχνική δραστηριότητα όπως η Καλαμάτα, ο θίασος ReAct αναζητά μία στέγη που να καλύπτει το καλλιτεχνικό του όραμα. Μια άλλη πρόταση σε σχέση με τα δημοτικά αμφιθέατρα που διαθέτει η πόλη, τα οποία μοιάζουν περισσότερο με συνεδριακά κέντρα παρά με θεατρικές σκηνές. Μια στέγη που θα υποδέχεται το κοινό φιλόξενα και θα δημιουργεί διαφορετική σχέση μεταξύ θεατών και ερμηνευτών από αυτή που επικρατεί στα θέατρα της πόλης. Μια στέγη που εκτός από μόνιμη έδρα της ομάδας θα είναι σε θέση να φιλοξενήσει με τους ευνοϊκότερους όρους τόσο άλλους επαγγελματικούς θιάσους από όλη την Ελλάδα, όσο και τους πολυάριθμους ερασιτεχνικούς θιάσους της πόλης.

Προκειμένου να πραγματοποιηθεί το όνειρο για την θεατρική σκηνή, ο θίασος ReAct ζητά την συμβολή σας. Προαγοράζοντας σε προνομιακή τιμή τα εισιτήριά σας για τις παραγωγές του θεάτρου θα βοηθήσετε να συμπληρωθεί το κεφάλαιο, ώστε να μετατραπεί ένα παλιό νηπιαγωγείο σε θεατρική σκηνή.

Ο θίασος ετοιμάζει δύο παραγωγές για τον Μάιο του 2016 και θα ήταν πολύ ευτυχές να ανέβουν στο καινούριο του σπίτι με την βοήθειά σας.

The professional theater company Re-Act, based in Kalamata, is trying to acquire a permanent home by converting an old nursery into theater.

The company was founded in 2015 by Kallirroi Velentza, actress, director and theatrologist and consists of professional actors and dancers. The main pursuit of the team is the study of modern Greek theater texts, especially new writers, through the codes of psychological theater and contemporary dance.

In an art-loving city with intense artistic activity such as Kalamata, Re-Act is seeking a roof to house its artistic vision. A different proposition in comparison with the typical municipal auditoriums available in the city, which pertain more to convention centers rather than theaters. A roof that will welcome the public warmly and create a different relationship between spectators and performers from the prevailing one in the theaters of the city. A roof, which apart from offering permanent headquarters to ReAct, will also be able to accommodate under the most favorable terms other professional companies from all over Greece as well as the numerous amateur groups of the city.

In order to realize its dream, ReAct is asking for your contribution. By pre-buying your tickets at a premium price for the theater productions, you help us raise the funds necessary to convert an old nursery into theater.

ReAct is preparing two productions for May 2016 and would be very happy to present them in its new home with your help.

Callirhoe's CV

story_txt: Ο επαγγελματικός θίασος ReAct, με έδρα την Καλαμάτα, προσπαθεί να δημιουργήσει μια μόνιμη στέγη μετατρέποντας ένα παλιό νηπιαγωγείο σε θεατρική σκηνή.Ο θίασος δημιουργήθηκε το 2015 από την Καλλιρρόη Βελέντζα, ηθοποιό, σκηνοθέτη και θεατρολόγο και αποτελείται από επαγγελματίες ηθοποιούς και χορευτές. Η κύρια ενασχόληση της ομάδας είναι η μελέτη κειμένων του νεοελληνικού θεάτρου, νέων κυρίως συγγραφέων, μέσω των κωδίκων του ψυχολογικού θεάτρου και του σύγχρονου χορού.Σε μία πόλη φιλότεχνη και με έντονη καλλιτεχνική δραστηριότητα όπως η Καλαμάτα, ο θίασος ReAct αναζητά μία στέγη που να καλύπτει το καλλιτεχνικό του όραμα. Μια άλλη πρόταση σε σχέση με τα δημοτικά αμφιθέατρα που διαθέτει η πόλη, τα οποία μοιάζουν περισσότερο με συνεδριακά κέντρα παρά με θεατρικές σκηνές. Μια στέγη που θα υποδέχεται το κοινό φιλόξενα και θα δημιουργεί διαφορετική σχέση μεταξύ θεατών και ερμηνευτών από αυτή που επικρατεί στα θέατρα της πόλης. Μια στέγη που εκτός από μόνιμη έδρα της ομάδας θα είναι σε θέση να φιλοξενήσει με τους ευνοϊκότερους όρους τόσο άλλους επαγγελματικούς θιάσους από όλη την Ελλάδα, όσο και τους πολυάριθμους ερασιτεχνικούς θιάσους της πόλης.Προκειμένου να πραγματοποιηθεί το όνειρο για την θεατρική σκηνή, ο θίασος ReAct ζητά την συμβολή σας. Προαγοράζοντας σε προνομιακή τιμή τα εισιτήριά σας για τις παραγωγές του θεάτρου θα βοηθήσετε να συμπληρωθεί το κεφάλαιο, ώστε να μετατραπεί ένα παλιό νηπιαγωγείο σε θεατρική σκηνή.Ο θίασος ετοιμάζει δύο παραγωγές για τον Μάιο του 2016 και θα ήταν πολύ ευτυχές να ανέβουν στο καινούριο του σπίτι με την βοήθειά σας.The professional theater company Re-Act, based in Kalamata, is trying to acquire a permanent home by converting an old nursery into theater.The company was founded in 2015 by Kallirroi Velentza, actress, director and theatrologist and consists of professional actors and dancers. The main pursuit of the team is the study of modern Greek theater texts, especially new writers, through the codes of psychological theater and contemporary dance.In an art-loving city with intense artistic activity such as Kalamata, Re-Act is seeking a roof to house its artistic vision. A different proposition in comparison with the typical municipal auditoriums available in the city, which pertain more to convention centers rather than theaters. A roof that will welcome the public warmly and create a different relationship between spectators and performers from the prevailing one in the theaters of the city. A roof, which apart from offering permanent headquarters to ReAct, will also be able to accommodate under the most favorable terms other professional companies from all over Greece as well as the numerous amateur groups of the city.In order to realize its dream, ReAct is asking for your contribution. By pre-buying your tickets at a premium price for the theater productions, you help us raise the funds necessary to convert an old nursery into theater.ReAct is preparing two productions for May 2016 and would be very happy to present them in its new home with your help.Callirhoe's CVΣΠΟΥΔΕΣ:2012-2015:	Δραματική σχολή Θεάτρου Τέχνης Καρόλου Κουν. story:
The Genesis Play 

53,000 people annually are diagnosed with breast cancer in the UK, but what if there is a way to stop the disease before it even begins?

WHAT IS THE PROJECT?

GENESIS is a new play about breast cancer prediction and prevention, which highlights the human response to genetic testing for the condition.  This project is about using theatre to tell the stories of the people behind the science.

We spoke to breast cancer patients and their families, scientists, geneticists, nurses and doctors. Their worries, memories, experiences and anecdotes are some of the most incredible stories we have ever encountered and we now want to give them a platform so their voices can be heard.

Written by award-winning playwright Frazer Flintham and produced by Forward Theatre Project – www.forwardtheatreproject.co.uk the play has been developed through a two-year research attachment to Genesis Breast Cancer Prevention – www.genesisuk.org, a ground-breaking charity based at Wythenshawe Hospital, South Manchester. Genesis Breast Cancer Prevention are the only UK charity that focuses solely on researching preventative measures for breast cancer.

The play shines a light on this vital, under-appreciated work and ultimately encourages a better public understanding of the world of cancer prevention. It will also inspire a wide-ranging debate about the complexities of preventative medicine.

HELP US PUT THE PLAY ON STAGE

We are asking for your help to get this play from page to stage. We aim to debut the play this Autumn at the Lowry Theatre in Manchester, Soho Theatre in London and CAST Theatre in Doncaster, as well as touring it to several other north-west venues.

To make this production and our supporting engagement programme possible we need to fundraise a total of £47,000.  We are seeking funding from Arts Council England and a number of private trusts and foundations but need to raise an additional £10,000 towards our total budget through this campaign. 

Our engagement programme will include:

  • Educational workshops for young women 
  • A photography exhibition of women who have had mastectomies
  • Pre- and post-show discussions with our collaborating scientists and creatives.

The money raised will contribute towards the costs of rehearsing, making, designing, promoting and transporting this production and will enable us to appoint an education coordinator to run workshops with young women which supports them to have healthier relationships with their own bodies.

We think this work is vital. We want these voices to be heard.

Help us give cancer prevention a voice and donate now.

To thank you for your contribution we have some great rewards in place including dinner on us in either London, Manchester or Doncaster and exclusive 1:1 backstage tours round the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden!

Thank you,

Charlotte Bennett, Artistic Director, Forward Theatre Project

www.forwardtheatreproject.co.uk

www.genesisuk.org
story_txt:
The Genesis Play 

53,000 people annually are diagnosed with breast cancer in the UK, but what if there is a way to stop the disease before it even begins?




WHAT IS THE PROJECT?
GENESIS is a new play about breast cancer prediction and
prevention, which highlights the human response to genetic testing for the condition. 
This project is about using theatre to tell the stories of the people
behind the science.
We spoke to breast cancer patients and their families,
scientists, geneticists, nurses and doctors. Their worries, memories,
experiences and anecdotes are some of the most incredible stories we have ever
encountered and we now want to give them a platform so their voices can be
heard.
Written by award-winning playwright Frazer Flintham and produced
by Forward Theatre Project – www.forwardtheatreproject.co.uk
the play has been developed through a two-year research attachment to Genesis
Breast Cancer Prevention – www.genesisuk.org, a ground-breaking
charity based at Wythenshawe Hospital, South Manchester. Genesis Breast Cancer
Prevention are the only UK charity that focuses solely on researching
preventative measures for breast cancer.
The play shines a light on this vital, under-appreciated work
and ultimately encourages a better public understanding of the world of cancer
prevention. It will also inspire a wide-ranging debate about the
complexities of preventative medicine.

HELP US PUT THE PLAY ON STAGE
We are asking for your help to get this play from page to stage.
We aim to debut the play this Autumn at the Lowry Theatre in Manchester,
Soho Theatre in London and CAST Theatre in Doncaster, as well as touring

story:
(Per i pochi di voi che non masticano bene l'inglese, non vi preoccupate, continuate a scorrere il testo e troverete la traduzione in italiano!)

 

WHO WE ARE

Teatro delle Due is an Italian-based nonprofit organization that produces educational and cultural initiatives geared toward students, as well as all those who wish to experience the English language in an immediate, live, and engaging way.

In order to guarantee the highest quality theatrical productions, Teatro delle Due calls on native speakers of English to direct and act in its Shakespeare productions, offering audiences in Reggio Emilia, Bologna, Modena, and the surrounding areas the opportunity to experience performances that they could only otherwise see by traveling outside Emilia-Romagna, if not outside the country.

Over the last 10 years, Teatro delle Due has been seen by tens of thousands of audiences members and been consistently well received for our clarity of language, humor, truth, and simplicity. The enthusiastic response we have had from our audiences in the form of numerous letters, personal conversations, and other overwhelmingly positive feedback, is a testament to the continued positive reverberations of our work in the community and in the lives of our audiences.

 

PINOCCHIO in NEW YORK!

Teatro delle Due’s Pinocchio means to celebrate Italian culture and to connect with all people who hold closely to their heart their own Italian heritage!

After 10 years of bringing professional American actors to Italy to produce an annual Shakespeare production, Teatro delle Due is now setting its sights on bringing a piece of Italy to America.  Our aim is to continue and deepen the tradition of fresh cultural exchange we have established in Italy since our foundation. We have always introduced Shakespeare in its original language to Italian audiences with the best representation of the text possible, giving thousands of people the opportunity to experience Shakespeare in English for the first time.  Now, we wish to reverse this with our time in New York, and introduce classic Italian theater to American audiences.

Carlo Collodi wrote The Adventures of Pinocchio between 1880 and 1883 in Florence, Italy. It is the most translated and read non-religious book of all time. The original story, though written for children, was much darker and harsher than the Disney version, and told a tale of a mischievous marionette that learns many of life’s lessons the hard way. 

Teatro delle Due will produce a simplified, truthful, and original adaptation of this story on stage this fall. We plan to collaborate with Italian actors and storytellers who are currently in New York pursuing their theatrical craft. We also plan to bring one of Teatro delle Due’s Italian producers, Valeria Bottazzi, to New York to be the leading storyteller of the production, collaborating with the cast.  We hope that this will give an exciting opportunity to Italian actors and those studying acting in New York who are looking to utilize their culture and heritage in the practice of their craft.

 

WHEN and WHERE

Rehearsals will begin in New York on October 23, with an opening night of November 10 at the Alchemical Theatre Laboratory in downtown Manhattan. 

 

GOALS and BENEFITS

Our financial goal in order to make this project happen is $9,000.  This will ensure that we are able to fund the following:

  • Rehearsal and Theater Space Rentals
  • Set, Costume, & Lighting Design
  • Transportation and Housing for Italian Actor(s)
  • Promotional Materials
  • Organizational Costs (Cast & Crew Stipends, Management, Fees, etc.)

AND, when you donate towards this goal, you could also be the recipient of one of the following exciting perks:

  • Social Media Shout-Out
  • Tickets to the Show
  • Signed Poster
  • Signed Copy of our Original Script
  • An Italian Happy Hour with the Cast
  • Producer Credits
  • A Private Cooking Class with Biba Bottazzi
  • A Private Portrait Session with Ryan Prado Photography
  • and MORE!!!

If you're unable to donate financially, but still want to be a part of everything, please contact us and we can find a way!  We'd be thrilled to have as many people involved as possible!  Even simply sharing this on Facebook or Twitter would be greatly appreciated!

THANK YOU and GRAZIE for considering a contribution to our project!  We are so excited about taking this next, HUGE step as a company, and would be beyond thrilled if you were to help us do so!  Teatro delle Due has been a force in Reggio Emilia for 10 years now, and we are ready to show America what we can do! 

 

In Italiano:

 

PINOCCHIO A NEW YORK!

Dopo aver portato per 10 anni spettacoli shakesperiani in Italia con attori madrelingua americani, Teatro delle Due è pronto per fare il percorso inverso : attori madrelingua italiani che si esibiscono su un palco newyorkese in italiano! L'obiettivo è quello di  continuare ad approfondire lo scambio culturale fra Italia e Usa, approfondendo i classici del teatro italiano.

Pinocchio è il testo scelto per inaugurare questa nuova avventura ,che verrà prodotto da Teatro delle Due in un adattamento semplificato ed originale.  La compagnia intende collaborare con attori italiani residenti a New York portando in città una delle due fondatrici del Teatro, Valeria Bottazzi che sarà il narratore e traino dello spettacolo.

DOVE E QUANDO

Le prove inizieranno a New York il 23 Ottobre 2016 e lo spettacolo debutterà il 10 Novembre all'Alchemical Theatre Laboratory a Manhattan.

OBIETTIVI E BENEFICI

Per far si che questo progetto si possa realizzare abbiamo la necessità di raccogliere 9000 $. Con questa somma la compagnia potrà:

*Noleggiare il teatro e la sala prove
*Provvedere all'allestimento, luci e costumi
*Spese di trasferta per gli attori
*Realizzazione di materiale promozionale
*Coprire i costi organizzativi

E, quando donerete, riceverete dei piccoli o grandi regali per ringraziarvi del vostro supporto:

*Pubblicità sui social media
*Biglietti per lo spettacolo
*Locandine autografate
*Copione autografato
*Un aperitivo italiano con il cast
*Crediti come produttori dello spettacolo
*Una lezione privata di cucina con Valeria Bottazzi
*Una sessione fotografica privata con il fotografo Ryan Prado

Grazie e thank you! Siamo pronti per mostrare all'America di che Pasta siamo fatti!

 

SEE YOU SOON!!!

A PRESTO!!!

story:
ABOUT:

Beloved is a story about recovering from wounds that won't heal.

Based on a true story, Beloved follows one woman's journey through devastating loss and into her ultimate transformation. Her story encompasses things we can't imagine living through until we have: the death of child, the loss of fertility and the end of love through betrayal. Through movement and visual art, this collaborative performance piece examines the universal experiences of grief and heartbreak and explores how we reinvent ourselves after life's darkest turns. 

MISSION:

Created by authors Anastasia Gambill and Monica Welty, Beloved's mission is to bring a raw, vulnerable, honest and moving portrayal of subjects not often looked at in our culture. This piece resonates with the deepest, truest parts in all of us. It explores our common experience of loss and struggle and the way that we connect with each other through the process of healing. Those who are involved with Beloved find themselves more alive, less alone, and transformed right along with our main character.

Beloved will be developed through Gambill's 2016 Artist in Residency award with Yoga Refuge in Portland, OR.  This 10 month project includes art exhibits, workshops and community events around Beloved's themes. It culminates in two weekends of performances in October 2016.

PRODUCTION:
Beloved includes the creative talents of 7 artists: a filmmaker, a composer, a photographer, a textile designer, an illustrator and two authors/visual artists.

Each collaborator will create a unique body of work based on the story of Beloved that will be an integral aspect of the final performance piece. Beloved has a multigenerational cast of 8 local performers, dancers and vocalists. In addition, we will have a full crew: production manager, stage manager and desinger, construction, sound and lighting. 


In addition to creating a beautiful piece of art that sheds light on taboo subjects, our mission of equal importance is to pay our collaborators. Especially as Portland housing and cost of living expenses skyrocket, we want to contribute to keep Portland's cutting edge art culture alive and thriving. We endeavor to pay our artists, cast and crew their full fee, including materials and supplies.


What We Need & What You Get

We have an ambitious fundraising goal! We will be fundraising for the next 10 month in various campaigns starting here first. Your donations will go towards:

$15,000
  • $7,000 - Artists Fees and Materials:   1.) a film that serves as an integral part of the set design and a stand alone film     2.)  an original score for the 90 minute production      3.) a graphic novel and framed illustrations   4.) costume design and installation exhibit   5.) theatrical portraits of cast and photography of production and performance    6.) the authors of Beloved and visual art of collage
  • $8,000 - Cast and Crew:    1.)  8 cast members who will spend 3 month in rehearsals and perform 4 shows over 2 weekends     2.) 7 crew members: director, a production manager, stage manager, set designer, light technician, sound technician, contractor/set builder, and gallery curator

$10,000

  • Production - Monies will be used to purchase props and set construction materials. The vast majority of these will be repurposed so that our production does not create more waste for our planet and community. Other materials like sound, lighting and film equipment will be purchased or rented. Chairs, curtains and the like for the performances.
  • Marketing - website development and maintenance, print promotion like posters, fliers and postcards (minimal), payment for our marketing director
  • Events - Each artist will have an opening and exhibit at Yoga Refuge, Beloved's home. We will supply light snacks and beverages at each event as well as purchase plates, cups etc.

In Kind Donations and Cutting Costs

  • Space -Yoga Refuge is donating the space for our art exhibits, rehearsal and performance for an entire year! Anastasia was awarded an artist in residency here this year and this donation significantly cuts down on our costs. We are so grateful.
  • Artist, cast and crew fees - Many of the people on Beloved's team have offered partial donation of their time. It is our mission to pay everyone involved their full value but we will gratefully accept these offers from all who are willing. One of artists is applying for her own grant!
  • Production - We will use found objects as much as possible for our set. We are already purchasing beautiful props and costumes through second hand stories for fractions of their actual value. We are asking our friends, family and community for donations of goods and services to support Beloved's production.

Perks

We are grateful for each and every dollar! For this first round of fundraising we are offering the following perks for your generous donations:

  1. $25:  photo print from Beloved’s rehearsals and production
  2. $50: mp3 of Beloved's original score
  3. $100: print of a collage created by Monica and Anastasia as scene and character development and exhibited at Yoga Refuge
  4. $200: gift certificate for a one hour massage with Monica
  5. $250: gift certificate for a private Pilates session with Anastasia
  6. $300: an original collage
  7. $500: production print, original score, collage print
  8. $1000: 2 tickets to opening night and your choice of any one of the above perks

If we don't meet our goal...

We plan on it! But if we don't meet our goal, your generous donations will go to pay our artists as much as possible to meet their fees and purchase necessary supplies. It will be used for procuring necessary set elements and props. We will cover all of the necessities to make the production powerful, beautiful and professional. This is our dream and we will make it happen with your generosity and support!


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that a financial contribution is not possible for everyone.

Will you support us still?

  • Share - Facebook, Twitter, Email, Linked In, Instagram! Help us spread the word by sharing with your online communities. Mamas groups, grief groups, dance, theater and art people, musicians and more. Talk about it, invote people tp events, hand out fliers. Your sharing our project will allow it to grow and be supported in ways we can't even imagine. It's the magic of community and a HUGE gift!
  • Volunteer - We can use your unique skills and your extra time for lots of different aspects of this project. Anything from computer work, social networking, designing fliers, distributing promotional materials, shopping for costumes and props at vintage and second hand stores, build sets, refinishing props, small sewing projects, set up and clean up at events, and...and...and

 We are truly a collaboration. We are truly a community.  Every share, every like, every dollar, every telling of our story gets us closer to our dream of Beloved coming true in its mos ideal form

Thank you for your support!

story:
Give before March 9 to enjoy free tickets to the March 10, 11, and 12 performances in New York City!

March 2016, the extraordinary dancers of Lydia Johnson Dance will take to the stage at Alvin Ailey in New York City to perform exceptionally choreographed pieces by Lydia Johnson.  Hard work, perseverance, dedication, talent, and beauty are just a few words that come to mind when one thinks of the world of dance. What makes it all worth it is when the dancers get to perform before an audience. The Lydia Johnson Dance performance season (March 10, 11, and 12—save the dates and join us!) brings this all to fruition, but it takes more than just ticket sales. The cost of the dancers’ salaries, rehearsal space, costumes, performance venue, and other expenses far exceed the amount brought in through ticket sales alone.  We need your help to make the incredible opportunity to see these dancers on the stage a reality. 

Audiences (not just critics) respond to Lydia Johnson’s dances because of their emotional and psychological resonance. Each dance creates its own realm, which we inhabit during the performance and long after. Lydia’s distinctive choreographic vocabulary draws on the great traditions of modern dance and ballet.  Last season’s performances caused quite a stir:

 “Finely wrought works”

“Followed the texture of the music wonderfully”

“Uncommon skill at matching ballet movement to music, both at the large scale of structure and in small, felicitous details”

“A trio of women reminiscent of the fates in George Balanchine’s La Valse”

  New York Times, June 15, 2015

ABOUT THE COMPANY

Founded in 1999, Lydia Johnson Dance has been consistently praised for its distinctive choreography, which uses components of ballet woven seamlessly into a contemporary dance vocabulary. The New York Times, The New Yorker, Backstage Magazine and Oberon’s Grove have critically acclaimed the Company for its annual New York Season. LJD has performed at Jacob’s Pillow Dance Festival, as well as the Great Friends Dance Festival in Newport RI and the Downtown Dance Festival in NYC.  Lydia Johnson has been a Guest Artist faculty member at the Peridance Capezio Center in New York where LJD presents Repertory Workshops for advanced and professional dancers.

Capturing a sense of the depth and spirit of the human struggle, Johnson’s evocative work is noted for an underlying sense of drama, which resonates through the predominantly abstract qualities of her choreography. Music is a powerful component of the Lydia Johnson Dance experience. Her musical selections include contemporary masters such as Osvaldo Golijov, Philip Glass, and Henryk Gorecki, as well as classical composers Franz Schubert and Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. As noted dance writer Philip Gardner explains in Oberon’s Grove, “There is thought, passion and tenderness in her work, and a depth of musical resonance that is very satisfying to behold.” Esteemed dance writer Jennifer Dunning wrote in The New York Times: “In dance that challenges the mind as well as the heart, Lydia Johnson often isolates and reworks components of classical ballet technique to create a sense of life flowing unhurriedly over mysterious human stories.”

Lydia Johnson Dance is honored to have been awarded Geraldine R. Dodge Foundation grants for the past six years and has received a Harkness Dance Center Space Grant from the 92nd Street Y.

LJD features dancers with great individuality and expressive ability. Through the years its company’s dancers have performed extensively with other highly acclaimed companies, among them: American Ballet Theater, New York City Ballet, the Paul Taylor Dance Company, Lar Lubovitch Dance Company, Suzanne Farrell, Colorado Ballet, American Repertory Ballet, Sacramento Ballet, Chicago Ballet and Twyla Tharp.

In the last two years LJD has expanded its relationship with ballet as a part of Lydia Johnson’s unique voice and vocabulary through its work with Deborah Wingert who is now the company’s Ballet Mistress. Ms. Wingert danced under Balanchine in the New York City Ballet for 15 years and is one of a small group of artists selected by The Balanchine Trust to set Balanchine’s works on other companies.  Ms. Wingert’s company ballet classes have added breadth to the LJD dancers balletic technique which must be melded with a “fall and recovery” aesthetic descended from early modern dance master Doris Humphrey’s work and combined also with a sense of the use of contemporary gesture.

The Lydia Johnson Dance School is strongly committed to increasing awareness of and involvement in contemporary dance. The LJD School Scholarship Fund gives financially disadvantaged young people the opportunity to study technique and choreography, and experience the unique creative process of creating a dance.

Come See Us Live!

Lydia Johnson Dance spring performance season will take place on March 10, 11, and 12 at Ailey Citigroup Theater in New York City.  For information on ticket reservations, visit our website www.lydiajohnsondance.org.

We will say “Thank You” in several ways!

Every gift, big or small, helps us get closer to our goal.  Gifts (depending on your level of support) will be recognized in a variety of ways such as inclusion on our online list of supporters, personal recognition through social media, free tickets to our NYC performances, preferred seating at Salons, and more. 

A gift at any level can be recognized in honor of a dancer in the Company, Lydia Johnson, or anyone else you wish to champion and recognize.

Gifts of all amounts are received with gratitude and make an impact on our success.

Lydia Johnson Dance Inc. is a not-for-profit organization. All contributions are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law.

Like us on Facebook!

https://www.facebook.com/Lydia-Johnson-Dance-26113423525/?fref=ts

Levels of Support

$25 - $99 Shout Out on Facebook!
$100-$249 Shout Out and 2 Free Tickets to NY Season 2016
$250-$499 Shout Out and 2 Free preferred seating tickets to NY Season 2016
$500-$999-Shout Out and 4 Free tickets to NY Season 2016

Gifts of $1000  and over are rewarded in several ways depending on amount including  tickets to out pre-theater Patron Party on Opening Night, private back stage tours, private attendance at rehearsals and underwriting credit.
To inquire: Info@lydiajohnsondance.org

Give before March 9 to enjoy free tickets to the March 10, 11, and 12 performances in New York City! March 2016, the extraordinary dancers of Lydia Johnson
Dance will take to the stage at Alvin Ailey in New York City to perform
exceptionally choreographed pieces by Lydia Johnson.  Hard work, perseverance, dedication, talent,
and beauty are just a few words that come to mind when one thinks of the world
of dance. What makes it all worth it is when the dancers get to perform before
an audience. The Lydia Johnson Dance performance season (March 10, 11, and 12—save
the dates and join us!) brings this all to fruition, but it takes more than
just ticket sales. The cost of the dancers’ salaries, rehearsal space,
costumes, performance venue, and other expenses far exceed the amount brought
in through ticket sales alone.  We need your help to make the incredible
opportunity to see these dancers on the stage a reality. 
Audiences (not just critics) respond to Lydia Johnson’s
dances because of their emotional and psychological resonance. Each dance
creates its own realm, which we inhabit during the performance and long after.
Lydia’s distinctive choreographic vocabulary draws on the great traditions of
modern dance and ballet.  Last season’s
performances caused quite a stir:
 “Finely wrought works” 
“Followed the texture
of the music wonderfully”
“Uncommon skill at
matching ballet movement to music, both at the large scale of structure and in
small, felicitous details”
“A trio of women
reminiscent of the fates in George Balanchine’s La Valse”
  New
York Times, June 15, 2015
ABOUT THE COMPANY
Founded in 1999, Lydia Johnson Dance has been consistently
praised for its distinctive choreography, which uses components of ballet woven
seamlessly into a contemporary dance vocabulary. The New York Times, The
New Yorker, Backstage Magazine and Oberon’s Grove have critically acclaimed
the Company for its annual New York Season. LJD has performed at Jacob’s Pillow
Dance Festival, as well as the Great Friends Dance Festival in Newport RI and
the Downtown Dance Festival in NYC.  Lydia Johnson has been a Guest Artist faculty
member at the Peridance Capezio Center in New York where LJD presents Repertory
Workshops for advanced and professional dancers. 
Capturing a sense of the depth and spirit of the human
struggle, Johnson’s evocative work is noted for an underlying sense of drama,
which resonates through the predominantly abstract qualities of her
choreography. Music is a powerful component of the Lydia Johnson Dance
experience. Her musical selections include contemporary masters such as Osvaldo
Golijov, Philip Glass, and Henryk Gorecki, as well as classical composers Franz
Schubert and Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. As noted dance writer Philip Gardner
explains in Oberon’s Grove, “There is thought, passion and tenderness in
her work, and a depth of musical resonance that is very satisfying to behold.”
Esteemed dance writer Jennifer Dunning wrote in The New York Times: “In dance that challenges the mind as well as
the heart, Lydia Johnson often isolates and reworks components of classical
ballet technique to create a sense of life flowing unhurriedly over mysterious
human stories.” 
Lydia Johnson Dance is honored to have been awarded
Geraldine R. Dodge Foundation grants for the past six years and has received a
Harkness Dance Center Space Grant from the 92nd Street Y.
LJD features dancers with great individuality and expressive
ability. Through the years its company’s dancers have performed extensively
with other highly acclaimed companies, among them: American Ballet Theater, New
York City Ballet, the Paul Taylor Dance Company, Lar Lubovitch Dance Company,
Suzanne Farrell, Colorado Ballet, American Repertory Ballet, Sacramento Ballet,
Chicago Ballet and Twyla Tharp.
In the last two years LJD has expanded its relationship with
ballet as a part of Lydia Johnson’s unique voice and vocabulary through its
work with Deborah Wingert who is now the company’s Ballet Mistress. Ms. Wingert
danced under Balanchine in the New York City Ballet for 15 years and is one of
a small group of artists selected by The Balanchine Trust to set Balanchine’s
works on other companies.  Ms. Wingert’s
company ballet classes have added breadth to the LJD dancers balletic technique
which must be melded with a “fall and recovery” aesthetic descended from early
modern dance master Doris Humphrey’s work and combined also with a sense of the
use of contemporary gesture. 
The Lydia Johnson Dance School is strongly committed to
increasing awareness of and involvement in contemporary dance. The LJD School
Scholarship Fund gives financially disadvantaged young people the opportunity
to study technique and choreography, and experience the unique creative process
of creating a dance.
Come See Us Live!
Lydia Johnson Dance spring performance season will take
place on March 10, 11, and 12 at Ailey Citigroup Theater in New York City.  For information on ticket reservations, visit
our website www.lydiajohnsondance.org.

story:
The Alliance Performance Center of Tucson is a new facility for the presentation of the performing arts,  located on the city’s Northeast side. The facility, known as the APCOT THEATER, will include theatre performances by Tucson’s numerous and talented theatre companies, music recitals and performances, dance groups and more. It will also be available for meetings and events. 

The organization’s board of directors are theatre people, not bureaucrats, knowledgable about what it takes to operate a facility for the performing arts. Actors, writers, directors, producers, technicians and others comprise the board. 

But, while we have the space, the seats, the people, we need technical equipment to operate a viable performance facility.  

Performing Arts, theatre, dance and music, are important to the growth of children and adults alike. It is a release of sorts. Experts say that children involved in the performing arts have I.Q.’s that run about 30% higher than those who do not participate. APCOT’s performing arm, the Tucson Alliance of Dramatic Artists will hold classes for you and young adults interested in learning everything from acting to tech. There will be children’s theatre and special events. It is important that as Tucson expands, were bring theatre to the East and Northeast sides.  

Until now, most of the performance spaces in Tucson have been restricted to the West side or Downtown areas. One on the East Side is a self producing company and generally sold out. This will bring theatre tho an audience of over 350 thousand people, many of whom do not travel Downtown. 

You notice, I use both theatre and theater. The facility is generally theater while the “art” is theatre. 

APCOT is a 501(c)(3) non-profit. Our goal is to break even. Everyone involved is a volunteer. Many pay their own expenses and help support the venture. 

After 3 years of searching for the right spot, we found a location and now need to equip that facility with lighting and sound equipment, boards, dimmers, cable, etc.. We need help in raising the funds in order tho open March 6, 2016.

Used light boards, monitors, dimmers, cable can cost in excess of $1500 to $2500. Sound boards about the same. Cable is expensive, as well. LED lights produce far less heat, creating comfort for actors on stage, lending to a more energized performance. Used LED’s can run over $800. We are not necessarily looking for top of the line, new equipment (we’d love to be able to, however). Some used equipment is quite good. 

If we are able to achieve more than our goal, the additional earned money will go toward additional lighting equipment, computers needed to help run the tech, tools and many other needed items. 

HAVE AN ANONYMOUS OFFER OF A $750 MATCHING GRANT FOR THE FIRST $750 WE BRING IN. 

If you can’t afford to contribute money, perhaps you know where we can locate some of this equipment as a donation. We are a 501(c)(3) and, with that, may come some tax advantages. If not, please send this to someone you know. They may be able to help.

The professional theater company Re-Act, based in Kalamata, is trying to acquire a permanent home by converting an old nursery into theater.

The company was founded in 2015 by Kallirroi Velentza, actress, director and theatrologist and consists of professional actors and dancers. The main pursuit of the team is the study of modern Greek theater texts, especially new writers, through the codes of psychological theater and contemporary dance.

In an art-loving city with intense artistic activity such as Kalamata, Re-Act is seeking a roof to house its artistic vision. A different proposition in comparison with the typical municipal auditoriums available in the city, which pertain more to convention centers rather than theaters. A roof that will welcome the public warmly and create a different relationship between spectators and performers from the prevailing one in the theaters of the city. A roof, which apart from offering permanent headquarters to ReAct, will also be able to accommodate under the most favorable terms other professional companies from all over Greece as well as the numerous amateur groups of the city.

In order to realize its dream, ReAct is asking for your contribution. By pre-buying your tickets at a premium price for the theater productions, you help us raise the funds necessary to convert an old nursery into theater.

ReAct is preparing two productions for May 2016 and would be very happy to present them in its new home with your help.

The main pursuit of the team is the study of modern Greek theater texts, especially new writers, through the codes of psychological theater and contemporary dance.In an art-loving city with intense artistic activity such as Kalamata, Re-Act is seeking a roof to house its artistic vision. A different proposition in comparison with the typical municipal auditoriums available in the city, which pertain more to convention centers rather than theaters. A roof that will welcome the public warmly and create a different relationship between spectators and performers from the prevailing one in the theaters of the city. A roof, which apart from offering permanent headquarters to ReAct, will also be able to accommodate under the most favorable terms other professional companies from all over Greece as well as the numerous amateur groups of the city.In order to realize its dream, ReAct is asking for your contribution. story:
What is The Vs. Series?

Hey Everyone! Bryant here. Creator of The Vs. Series, an interactive and collaborative fight night event that will come to life during the Philadelphia Fringe Festival in September 2016. Last year, I completed an intense theatre apprenticeship in Philadelphia that allowed me to gain a lot of skills, experiences, and confidence. After completing the program, I wanted to use all the skills I gained in one creative project. As I talked to more and more people, I realized a lot of people wanted the same things. So we decided to make our own opportunity; thus The Vs. Series was born.

We didn't want to create a normal show though. We wanted to create something that everyone could enjoy. We wanted a show that would be dramatic, comedic, heart-wrenching, and action-packed. We wanted to showcase the work of young artists, and we wanted to initiate meaningful conversation. So we decided that more people should be involved.

Over the past 6 months over a dozen young playwrights (some of whom have a plethora of experience, some of whom do not) wrote brief 10 minute plays. 

The only requirements: The plays had to be based around two opposites (peanut butter vs. jelly, republican vs. democrat, pen vs. sword for example) and the plays have to end in the stage direction “They Fight.” There could not be a line, stage direction, or hint as to who wins the fight. That decision is solely up to the audience.


Soon enough, the plays were narrowed down to five. Five directors, Five fight choreographers and an ensemble of actors will bring these shows to life, each of which has two separate endings. Now this is where you come in.


This project is big with nearly 50 people involved and 5 separate shows to produce, so not only do we have the typical costs associated with putting up a play, but we have more mouths to feed, more rehearsal space to find, more props to make, and more costumes to create. Through the generosity of friends, family, and mentors, we are off to a great start, but we aren’t done. We want you on our team.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking to raise $2,500 in addition to what we have already raised. Our funds so far cover space and basic costs. Now I do not believe that any artist should feel like they have to do work for free. Every person involved in this project will be compensated in some way, so that is where the bulk of the donations will go. You will be directly supporting the dreams and ambitions of young artists. The rest will go towards props, weapons rental (if you have a good lead on katana's, give us a shout), costumes, and marketing.
  • By donating you'll receive everything from a mention in our program and on facebook, to a four person table with a six pack of beer and backstage tour at one of our performances.
  • If we do not reach our goal, donations will first and foremost go towards supporting the artists involved. 

The Impact

"But Bryant! What makes this project soooo unique?" Let's break it down

  • This project is giving the opportunity to young artists to work in the industry they love in a professional environment
  • We are devoted to diversity with this project, so far 60% of our playwrights and 80% of our directors are women, That is incredibly uncommon and we are devoted to getting people from all backgrounds involved and represented
  • We want people to talk. The plays deal with some light topics, but also some difficult ones. Since all audience members vote secretly preshow, they can express their opinion without the need to conform to your social group.

Risks & Challenges

Putting up a live performance is risky! Anyone who says otherwise is lying. With so many people involved those risks are multiplied because things simply come up. But we are determined and we are devoted. This project can bring a lot of good, and we are committed to making it a reality. We have the support of a huge network and the mentorship of several leading theatre companies. We can do this.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Like us on Facebook and share this video!
  • Let us know if you want to be involved. We'd love to fight with you.

***Video Fight Choreography by Mike Magliocca, Logo by Kay Renee Design.

story:
Go Glorious. Give great theatre a chance!

I am Yaw Asiyama, the writer and dorector of GLORIOUS JONES-What This Woman Wants.  I have had the advantage of time, learning and experience to rework a play a wrote with a cast 0f  15, a live 5 piece band, 3 backing singers and a light and sound engineer, into a tight tourable engaging theatre piece with a cast of 5.  We are The Magnificent. With your help, we can do something incredible. With a beautiful and quality professional cast we are ready to go.

So what's next?

I am taking Glorious Jones to The Stables in Wavendion.8th April. 1 night only. Great journey really. Got a magnificent cast and this is testing grounds for a potential tour this Autumn or Spring 0f 2017. This journey to the stables requires your help. I need your support to make this reality.You can support us by...

  •  booking tickets for that night. ( http://www.stables.org/Whats_on/Event/Glorious_Jones)
  • making a contribution on this site. (There are many entry levels. all appreciated)
  • Sharing this campaign with all of your might. (Tell a friend or 2. Tell 10. tell a thousand )
  • Visit my website (www.yawshouse.com i am developing it daily)
What people thought of us at Stantonbury Theatre

"Heartmoving Extraordinary. Thank you!"

Laila Quilt

"Excellent writing, excellent acting, ravishing singing. Congratulations."

Euan Henderson

story:
MISSION

We are the Downtown Theatre Group, a Vegas 501c(3) nonprofit, and our mission is to build a theater. But not just any theater; a state of the art, three hundred to four hundred seat convertible space that can act as the catalyst of collaboration between the Las Vegas performing arts organizations; professional, community, and educational. We want to build a true community arts space in the heart of downtown Las Vegas, a place where anyone and everyone can come to play, learn, be entertained, and grow as artists. We will bring artistic opportunity to those that don’t have it, regardless of the level of artistry they currently possess, by subsidizing our services and making them accessible to all. We will bring the best of small equity productions from around the country to the Valley at an affordable price. We will provide a home to the countless talented Las Vegas performers who currently have no venue to display their art. And, we will make it our mission to provide support for other groups of artists who wish to open spaces of their own, so that the art and culture of Las Vegas will continue to grow, diversify, and provide us all with more opportunity to express ourselves, both on stages, and in our everyday lives.

VISION

Downtown Theatre Group was born out of conversations between three nationally accomplished theatre professionals who realized, as many before them had, that Las Vegas was without a true community arts space. The Off-Broadway movement in New York, The Second City movement in Chicago, The Hollywood Theatre Row in Los Angeles; all these movements of professional local art needed hubs to grow from, and so it was quickly realized that Las Vegas needed just such a hub. These ideas and dreams coalesced into a unique and repeatedly vetted non-profit business model, headed by a driven and passionate board of directors. In November 2015, after years of careful refinement of our business and monetary planning, we achieved federal 501(c)(3) non-profit status in just four weeks. These roads, travelled largely out of view, have led us here.

PASSION

This is where you come in. If this true community arts space is to move forward in development, retainers need to be paid, media needs to be developed, and fundraising needs to commence. So, we’re raising “30k’s in 30 days!” Why $30,000? Wouldn’t a facility like the one we’re describing cost much more than that? Absolutely; this will be a multi-million dollar project when it’s all said and done. So let’s break it down:

$30,000 – Feasibility studies and initial retainers for a philanthropic services team that specializes in major gifts campaigns for arts organizations.

This will highlight where our major donors are, and connects us to a team that can raise those millions of dollars. We also have additional STRETCH GOALS for this campaign, so we can tackle other needs concurrently:

$50,000 – Raising this amount allows us to retain our philanthropy team and immediately launch our major gifts campaign.

$75,000 – Raising this amount allows us do everything above, plus retain a respected design and construction firm that is very interested to work with us, and begin the architectural process.

$100,000 – Raising this amount allows us to do everything above , plus retain legal, financial, and brokerage services, which will be essential in moving the project forward.

These are not glamourous causes, but they are ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY if the space is going to be a reality. We need you to seed the project, and we’ll do the rest. Remember, donations are TAX DEDUCTIBLE (if you would like an e-mail verifying your tax-deductible donation, please use the PAYPAL option)!

SHARE with your friends and on social media! Campaigns work best when they go viral!

For more information, please visit our website at www.downtowntheatregroup.com

– Raising this amount allows us to do everything above , plus retain legal,
financial, and brokerage services, which will be essential in moving the
project forward.
These are not glamourous
causes, but they are ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY if the space is going to be a
reality. We need you to seed the project, and we’ll do the rest. Remember,
donations are TAX DEDUCTIBLE (if you would like an e-mail verifying your tax-deductible donation, please use the PAYPAL option)!
SHARE with your friends
and on social media! Campaigns work best when they go viral!
For more information,
please visit our website at www.downtowntheatregroup.com

story:
Short Summary

Between Us Productions is a theater company dedicated to producing plays about controversial issues by emerging artists.  Born in 2010, we have stayed committed to challenging our audiences to take a hard look at themselves and the world around them.

  • mONSTER gives us the opportunity to look at the issue of social media and it's role in both our personal lives and society. At a time when social media can determine everything from what we want to listen to  and wear to who will become President of the United States of America, it is time we really look at the hold social media has on all of us. Has it unleashed a monster within us?

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $3,000 to pay for the theater, props, costumes, set, lighting, rehearsal space, actor fees, projection design, marketing and all the other costs associated with theater.
  • We have perks ranging from signed postcards to free tickets and all the way down to free season tickets!
  • Even if we don't make our goal, the funds will still go to support the things listed above.

The Impact

  • In a world where the internet and social media has become a huge part of our lives,  mONSTER asks: is mass human adoption of new technology without new moral complication? Or has the harm of online culture always been the monster within us?
  • Between Us Productions has produced several successful plays about boundary pushing, controversial issues including: Diaspora by Gary Jaffe, Detainee by Sam Graber, The Fairer Sex by Sander Gusinow, Uprising by Jasmine Brown and Samantha Lee Manas, and many more.
  • This play will force us to take a hard look at how social media is influencing not just our own personal lives, but also how it's influencing society as a whole

Risks & Challenges

  • By far, our biggest challenge is securing funding to produce projects that force us to take a hard look at ourselves and the world around us. Finding computer equipment from 1994, creating videos of internet technology through time being used, and delving into the world of the early world wide web will take a massive quantity of time and effort.  It will also take money.
  • We will be putting our all in the look for these pieces of equipment and either secure real ones or create something that is accurate.  We will speak to people who remember it as well as doing our own research. Your donations will help us make this dream a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give, don't fret.  There are other ways you can help:

  • Share our campaign
    • whether it's email, social media, or word of mouth, tell people about us and get them to take a look and donate!
  • Use Indiegogo's share tools
  • Volunteer to help us with marketing, ushering, or several other jobs we need help with!

story:
What is Caravan Social Night?

Caravan Social Night is a cultural evening that connects live musicians and dance artists to create and deliver art to communities within social environments. In this inclusive night, we present showcases of collaborative works, open improvisation that invites musicians , dancers and audiences members from the crowd to create in the moment, forming one environment and creative space connecting everyone through live culture and art.

Caravan Social Night : Our Vision and Values

Empowering communities through art, live music and dance.

Bridging the gap between live musicians and dance artists through collaboration

Targeting audiences outside theatre and into social environments to reach communities disconnected from art and culture.

History

The origins of this project was envisioned by Chris Reyes,( Independent Hip Hop theatre Artist and choreographer)  and co - founder, Orin Norbert (Musician, Vocalist and DJ) who became involved with the project shortly after. Chris and Orin have trained within the London dance and music scene since the early 00s. The history and experiences within their respective fields has led to conversations on the current state of art between the music and dance communities. Chris believes there is a disconnection but also a lack of platforms endorsing community arts outside the theatre and art sectors.

Identifying the gap, Chris and Orin would soon form a team of dance artists and musicians to collaborate projects both within theatre and social environments. These projects would be housed under the umbrella name, Caravan Live Culture.

In 2017, Caravan Social Night was set up as a fundraising project to help raise the support needed to create for the immersive theatre Production, CARAVAN.

The donations raised from Caravan Social Night, allowed us to create our theatrical visions, CARAVAN IMMERSIVE & Research & Development of new work in progress, SEAN.

 

Caravan Vault Festival 2018

Winners of the people's Choice award

The fundraiser from Caravan Social Night allowed our team to create our immersive theatre vision in London's biggest immersive festivals, Vaults Festival. Out of 350 shows, CARAVAN won the People's Choice Award.

SEAN

Research & Development

 

A life journey that focusses on cultural displacement, Identity, immigration, Family traumas through the eyes of Sean, a British born filipino. SEAN is in the process of research & development and will develop later this year.

CARAVAN SOCIAL NIGHT at present

Caravan Social Night as it stands is a fundraising project. We have curated 5 evenings since 2017 which was financed from our pockets to help support travel for the artists, rental of rehearsal space, transportation and equipment hiring fees.

CROWDFUND

Summary and intentions

Our target of £5000 will provide us the resources vital for housing our platform within venues  but also facilitating the rehearsal space and time needed for muscians and dancers to create work.

Artist fee

Most artists pay for thier own rehearsals space and time to deliver thier craft for shows for audiences. There is no external support or organisation that support thier daily basic needs. We seek to change this through our crowd fund by providing a perfomance fee, covering travel allowances to and from rehearsals.

For every £150 - £200 raised supports an artist to rehearse, learn and develop from the rehearsal space down to the performance.

Rehearsal space

For every £25  raised through donations provides the space for musicians and dancers to rehearse for 1 day.

 - Equipment hire and transportation-

Every £80 we raise provides transport instruments to travel into different communities. 

- Venue hire fees -

For every £300 we raise contributes towards housing our platform within venues.

 

Challenges and risks

Transforming this project into its independent platform, supporting the musicians and artists is our first priority. To this end, the project requires a strong start up to help launch this project but also to sustain the longetivity this project holds.

The crowdfund will impact the support it can provide the artists involved. From travel allowance, expanding rehearsal hiring time, down to performance fee. The target we seek to raise will ensure the artists are supported during the preparation process and performance on the night.

To the Community

"Thank you all for taking your time to hear our vision and cause. The impact this project has on communities goes beyond our imaginations. As creators within the Arts world, we want to find a way to use art that went beyond the stage and that would act as a positive tool to create change in a fast changing society. This platform belongs to the people and can only build and grow from your influence. I hope the videos capture the impact this platform has to the artists, the public and the limitless potential it can have in the future."

Thank you for supporting the arts.

Caravan Family

 

and lastly,

Share our cause

Every donation takes us one step closer to achieving our goal. We want to reach as many people , going beyond our communities. Sharing this crowdfund will allow them to discover our purpose and help reach our awareness to undiscovered communities.

find us on our channels and family social media channels dedicated to this project.

Caravan Live Culture (instagram)

Alias Ldn (instagram/facebook/twitter)

Omg Collective (Instagram/Facebook)

story:
We, (Janice L. Goldberg and Kristine Niven) have been artistic partners at AND Theatre Company for 15 years.  It’s a crazy marriage but one that works.  Mainly because our common goal has been to dare each other to break out of our individual comfort zones, shake ourselves up, and challenge other artists and patrons of the arts to do the same damn thing! Without-a-Net certainly lives up to its calling.  It is a project we have been developing for over ten years. Brought to us, initially, by mutual friends, we have presented 4 previous Without-a-Nets. Each version supports a different cause but the m.o. remains the same.  Dare each other and all involved to dance without a net, venture into the unknown, live in the moment, have faith in each other, and find new artistic directions.  And pay people!

With Lights Out! we are exploring the relationship between three women related by genetics but seemingly far apart in their approach to life.  Set in a small town library, Lights Out! looks at the cultural phenomenon of the modern library within the context of the lives of these three women. Today’s Library is much more than a repository of books.  It is a provider of services to a community.  Each community with its own needs. The conflict between old school ideas of what a library is or should be is often linked to the older members of the community being uncomfortable with the new demands on library services as well as with the younger folks not understanding the past.  Twenty five years ago,  the public library was looked to for reference work and reading material. Today the ‘reference librarian’ is connected to the inter-web more often than to the card catalogue (the what?). The Library itself can be a sanctuary for the homeless looking for warm respite and a clean restroom, for the out of work using library computers to search for employment, or even folks needing to use the library’s free wi-fi to do their own computer work.  

Without-a-Net asks the actor to know his lines and his character and to take that information into a world where he/she doesn’t know how the other character will respond emotionally or physically, similar to our own experiences in real life. You can help us continue our exploration of what it means to be in the moment.

We are asking for funds to help pay these intrepid 25 actors and 5 directors in this adventure as well as design and production crew.  Our needs are simple and dollars simply make it happen.  Our budget is the relatively small amount of $24,000.  The majority of this is for facility rental (2 weeks of a 60-seat theatre in New York City, rehearsal space for 5 acting teams, production meetings and auditioning space) and the second largest chunk is for actor, designer and crew fees.  

We anticipate ticket sales to bring in one third of our budget.  ANDTheatre, our producing company which also provides non-profit status for tax deductible donations, will provide another third from general funding.  Our hope is for you to help us with the final third so that we can provide our designers and audience with a tip top, rip roaring experience.

As a donor, we promise you a unique theatrical experience along with the warm feeling of having helped bring to light the issue of the importance of libraries to this digitally focused world.  

As our video attests, the experience of Without-a-Net has been mind expanding for both audience and actor.  We try, with these small plays, to bring awareness of a specific social situation to our audiences. Our first Without-a-Net was centered around New York City’s unique situation of public school teacher rubber rooms.  Our second looked at the continuing difficulty of employment and job security. We’ve also tackled the effect of imprisoned people on their loved ones and the difficulty of returning home. Lights Out! Is our look at the new library.
