story:
Audience Reviews for Chromatics:

"Excellent production, acting, and singing. Funny, uplifting, sad and extremely relatable for young adults (and all audiences)."

"Wow. I cried – twice. Beautiful harmonies, realistic situations and characterisations, wonderful arrangements."

"Stunning music, really well constructed. Beautiful performances from a great cast."

  • Polliwog Theatre Collective have been producing new Irish work since 2014, performing four shows at Smock Alley Theatre, Dublin since then. Chromatics started life as a work in progress at the Scene + Heard Festival in Smock Alley in 2017 and has gone on to be performed at the Mill Theatre, Dundrum in April 2018 to sell-out performances. Chromatics hit the West-End stage in London in May 2018 when it was chosen to be performed at the Other Palace, London for Musical Bites.
  • Our campaign is to help us raise the essential funds for our next production of Chromatics at the Mill Theatre in Dundrum. This will be the third rendition of Chromatics on the stage and the best yet. West-End director, Andrew Keates, is joining us in Dublin to continue his work on Chromatics following it's West-End debut and take our Irish musical to the next level in regard to design and production. 
  • Your contribution will help us achieve the set, lighting and sound elements that a show as beautifully written as Chromatics deserves. Lots of costs go into getting a show on stage, and there are not many funding avenues for new Irish musicals. Your support will contribute to Irish musical theatre in it's core stages and help take Chromatics to the next level.
  • Want more info? Click here to check out this awesome review of Chromatics at Smock Alley Theatre!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need €2,500 to put towards our sound costs (or the audience won't hear the show), set design (or the audience will need a big imagination), lighting (or we'll have lots of bruised actors) and marketing (is it a show without an audience?). If we hit our target, this money will contribute to these essential costs!
  • However, we don't expect you to part with your hard-earned money for nothing! We have some exclusive Chromatics perks for our generous funders including a live recording of Chromatics at the Mill, Dundrum, tickets for our opening night show and reception, endless and bountiful thanks and that great feeling you get when you contribute to the future of Irish musical theatre!
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will be very upset. But we will truck on. If we hit less than 100% of our goal, any funds raised will mostly go to our sound costs and we will continue to fundraise by hosting fundraising events to get us closer to our target. We'll also be as resourceful as we can - maybe everyone in the audience could bring their bedside lamp to bring some fresh vibes to the lighting?

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Chromatics is a valuable project as it's revival at the Mill Theatre with a West-End director is an incredibly special phenomenon which is not often encountered on the Irish musical theatre scene. It proves that the quality of Shauna Carrick's composition and script is of a standard not regularly seen. Your contribution will make a difference to the creators of Chromatics and the life this show takes on in the future. This is a rare opportunity for Chromatics to get incredible exposure to the big-wigs of London musical theatre, and the musical theatre world beyond!
  • Chromatics has already enjoyed sold-out performances at the Mill Theatre, Dundrum, so we are simply giving the people of South Dublin what they want.
  • The Chromatics team have a wealth of experience producing and creating musical theatre and theatre in Dublin, London, Edinburgh and further afield. If you're still not 100% sure, check out the biogs of our wonderful team below and you'll be assured that your contribution is in safe and very experienced hands!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're reading this and are absolutely devastated that you cannot contribute to Chromatics right now, never fear! Our campaign runs for 21 days, so you never know, you might win the lotto by then!

There are lots of other ways you can help. 

  1. Sharing is caring - please share our campaign with your friends, family and co-workers! Every share = €5 on average! Emailing or messaging your loved ones directly goes a lot further than a share on Facebook (unless you're Barack Obama). Get in touch if you need any material to help you spread the word! - polliwogtheatrecollective@gmail.com
  2. Come and see the show! Our two most favourite groups of people in the world are our contributors and the audiences who come to enjoy our hard work. Come along, sing along, laugh along, cry along, we'd love to see you there! You can buy your tickets here.
  3. Follow us on social media. As we said, we're resourceful people! We'll be putting out notice of other ways you can help as our schedule progresses and we get closer to performance time :-)

Thank you - wow, I can't believe you've read all this! You deserve a treat. Thank you in advance to our contributors. Your contribution will make a huge difference to Chromatics and it's future! Here's to new Irish musical theatre! :-)

Lots of love,

The Chromatics Team

story:
DEAR FRIENDS,

Join Lenora Lee Dance (LLD), in the re-staging of its award winning immersive, multimedia dance theater piece, Within These Walls (WTW), at the Angel Island Immigration Station, alongside its full length da​nce film and creation of its sequel Dreams of Flight.

WTW premiered in a two-week run 9/9-9/17/17 at the Angel Island Immigration Station Barracks and is receiving incredible acclaim, through a Special Achievement Award for Outstanding Production by the Isadora Duncan Dance Awards Committee. Hien Huynh, one of the main cast members who played a character inspired by the life of Wong Gong Jue, is nominated for Outstanding Achievement in Performance by an Individual for his incredibly moving performance in the piece. LLD has been touring excerpts of the work in Los Angeles, Boston, New York City, with the possible re-staging of the full work on tour in Boston and other cities in 2019 and 2020.

WTW is dedicated to the 170,000 Chinese who were detained, interrogated and processed at the Station between 1910 - 1940 as a result of the Chinese Exclusion Act. The Exclusion Act tore families apart and resulted in a mass incarceration experience that forever stamps the experience of Chinese in America. It was the first piece of legislation to restrict anyone from another country from immigrating to the U.S. It was enforced until 1943, with quotas until 1965, an 83 year period of Exclusion, which set precedent for anti-immigration laws to follow.  

We are again at a particular crossroad in our nation’s journey with the current administration. The rights of immigrants, women, children, the impoverished, and communities of color are being heavily threatened. In the context of today’s mass detention of immigrants and the national debate taken to a new level, there is an acute sense of urgency in promoting efforts to engage the public in the process of reconciliation and restorative justice embodied in the effort to share the story of the Angel Island Immigration Station. The public’s engagement with this historic site is not only one of education or curiosity, but an affirmative, deeply felt, effort at healing.

 

GOING FORWARD INTO OUR 12TH SEASON

WTW remains one of LLD's strongest and most ambitious works. It was an exhilarating experience that brought many to tears, including us. With immense displays of love and support from numerous communities across the country, we feel extremely thrilled and honored to announce the re-staging of WTW and its sequel Dreams of Flight at the Angel Island Immigration Station for three weekends in May, 5/4 - 5/19/19! This will be our longest performance run to date, a necessary and bold next step in making this pivotal work more accessible to the public. 

Your support will also contribute to the creation of a dance film based on our WTW (2017) production, directed by award winning filmmaker/musician/composer Tatsu Aoki.  Our last collaborative film with Tatsu, LIGHT, won Best Experimental Film at the Canada International Film festival in 2017.  The WTW film will premier in Fall 2019, and will be made available to the broader public through the creation and sale of a DVD box set of this major signature piece.

 

Immigrants Tormented as Angel Island Detainees Recreated in Dance - By Beth Spotswood, SF Chronicle, 9/14/17

AUDIENCE FEEDBACK FROM WTW

“I thought about ICE jails, people who fear deportation, and refugees overseas. It was heavy….and so beautiful.”

“It was a truly unique and powerful experience, and I feel fortunate to have witnessed it. It snuck into my dreams last night.”

“Moving and beautifully rendered, and of course, so timely given the global dialogue around immigration. I was there with my seven year old son, and the piece made a big impression on him.”

“I was deeply affected and moved by the performance. I left in tears, and literally cried every time I replayed the performance in my head for 4 days afterward.”

“It was brilliant and emotionally powerful.”

We strongly feel that LLD's work profoundly impacts and transcends light deeply across communities. To envelope and amplify LLD's work to its fullest potential, we graciously ask for your support. The contributions you make are vital and link directly to the continued flow of LLD.

 

WE WANT TO RAISE $15,000 IN 30 DAYS

We have been able to raise a portion of the money needed through individual donations, grants and sponsorships and have been working day in and day out to develop and plan this re-staging, sequel, and film. We have hit a critical point and are reaching out to you for much needed support.

 

WHAT WILL YOUR MONEY BE USED FOR?

The minimum we need to raise is $15,000 to support the re-staging of Within These Walls and the creation of its sequel Dreams of Flight to be performed May 2019. This is the minimum which would require us to make sacrifices in certain areas. We hope we will not have to make these difficult decisions, as we want to realize the greatest vision for the work. Nevertheless, we will create the fullest expression with the resources available, as this art is vital and these narratives provide a crucial compassionate lens to the experiences, never to be forgotten.

YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP:

-       Cover a portion of the artist & production fees for the artistic director, 12 dancers, media designer, production crew = over 3,100 hours of combined production time by 18 people

-       Cover some of the over 900 hours of administrative, outreach, and planning work required to get the production up, running, successfully publicized and implemented by our 3 staff members and dozens of volunteers 

 

If we exceed the goal and make our way to $30,000 to enter Phase 2: Creation of the Within These Walls experimental dance Film, you will be helping to:

-       Cover some of the costs for the filmmaker & editors for the hundreds of hours of post-production editing, sound and color correction

 

If we exceed the goal and make our way to $45,000 to enter Phase 3, DVD to the broader public, you will be helping to:

-       Cover some of the costs of producing the Within These Walls dance film DVD / CD box set for distribution to the national public late 2019 (cost of materials, production and packaging, building prototypes, graphic design for DVDs of the Film & Performance footage, CD Soundtrack, Photo book, and packaging) 

 

WHAT WILL YOU RECEIVE IN RETURN?

In addition to:

- exercising your sense of agency in supporting these works rooted in shedding light on social injustices, crimes against immigrant populations (of which we are all descendants),

- feeling the heartwarming satisfaction of contributing to major performance and film works which are gaining national recognition and up for touring possibilities in other cities,

- you will receive the perks available to you listed along the right side of this page.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

If we are not able to raise the full amounts, we will need to push the creation of the dance film DVD / CD box set into 2020, and possibly the premiere of the film as well. We are so excited to bring the piece to you through the film, and allow it to have a long and international life through the creation of the film and distribution of the DVD box set. We hope to make this a reality with your support.

 

ADDITIONAL WAYS TO CONTRIBUTE

-    If your company has a Matching Gifts Program, your donation can go twice as far.  Please contact me at LenoraLeeDance@gmail.com to inquire about the details

-    If you have airline miles you can donate, we would greatly appreciate the contribution!!  Please email LenoraLeeDance@gmail.com

 

YOU CAN HELP SPREAD THE WORD TO YOUR FRIENDS, COLLEAGUES, AND NETWORKS ABOUT THIS PROJECT AND OUR REQUEST FOR SUPPORT! 

The timing is critical.

We seek to share a sense of gratitude for life and our lived experiences. The power in sharing these truths is boundless and with your support, we will continue to bring the possibilities to life.

 

With much appreciation, love, light & gratitude,

Lenora Lee Dance

www.LenoraLeeDance.com

 

Angel Island a historical setting for Lenora Lee’s ‘Walls’ - By Leslie Katz, SF Examiner, 9/7/17

About the Making of WTW, what’s behind the stories - video by Qianru Li, Guoyu Liu, Michael Kennedy 2018

 

Lenora Lee Dance is fiscally sponsored by Asian Pacific Islander Cultural Center, a non-profit tax-exempt organization. All donations to Lenora Lee Dance are fully deductible to the extent allowed by law.

Videography by Olivia Ting, Shannon Preto, Lenora Lee, Editing by Lenora Lee

Photos by Robbie Sweeny

story: At the end of Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream the young lover Demetrius is left drugged and tricked into marriage. Help us bring Soren Oliver's Demetrius Unbound to life and find out what happens to Demetrius as the drug wears off and he discovers his life anew. A world premiere produced by The Bare Flag Theatre Company: local, sustainable, organic art.
story_txt: At the end of Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream the young lover Demetrius is left drugged and tricked into marriage. Help us bring Soren Oliver's Demetrius Unbound to life and find out what happens to Demetrius as the drug wears off and he discovers his life anew. A world premiere produced by The Bare Flag Theatre Company: local, sustainable, organic art.

story:
I'm Beth Hodd. I am a Shakespeare enthusiast with a penchant for sunny days in parks. As an actor/director/writer in training I decided that I should bring The Tempest to life - in a park. My aim being for everyone to get home, sit down with a cuppa and say "what a lovely afternoon".

I want everyone to love Shakspeare as much as I do. whether that's a tiny tot making a tempest tantrum, or a triumphant teen enjoying painting our tempestuous production. It should be a wholly enjoyable event for anyone.

Without you, we will get nowhere. We need your support to make this happen. This production is non-profit, with people working for free. We are doing this for the sake of Shakespeare. We need you!

What We Need & What You Get

The entirety of the money raised (£518) will be going towards paying for public liability insurance. Any outdoor event must be covered by public liability insurance for the safety of the audience and participants. The rest of money that we need to raise is the money paid to Indiegogo for using flexible funding.

It's expensive but needs to be done, the rest of the production is running on a tiny budget of which comes out of my pocket and the other creatives  working with me 

But we won't be the only ones benefiting from this. As a thank you we are offering some fantastic rewards for your kindness that stretch from personalised poems to a piece of costume from the production! We want to ensure that you get something back from the massive kindness you show us.

If the target is not met, we will be a humongous pickle. All your wonderful donations will still go towards the insurance and we will have to begin picking pennies out of the back of the sofa to cover the rest.

The Impact

Shakespeare is probably the most famous writer of all time, and it's only right that everyone and anyone should be able to enjoy his work. With so many interpretations, our production opens Shakespeare up to young children, teen children, parents, adults, artist, cake lovers, music enthusiasts alike! It also gives an opportunity for all kinds of artists whether they are actors or painters to cooperate in a project that will be a happy memory. and maybe inspire others onto other projects.

Risks & Challenges

Using as much promotion as possible whether that be local radio, or going to local schools to ensure we get a sizeable audience, will also be a chance to present any monetary issues we may have.

Online crowd funding can be a risk and with using flexible funding, it's very real that we might not meet our target. Events which will also promote the show like street performing and using the proceeds to pay for the insurance will ensure that this event still goes ahead. The amount of work the cast, I and others have put into this too precious to throw away, the show must go on!

Other Ways You Can Help Us

We completely understand that you may not be able to donate but still want to help. So we would be eternally grateful if you could promote our event and crowdfunder campaign! Our event is on Facebook, we have a Twitter page and you can follow the cast on Instagram. Spread the word, come to the show, keep talking about it online, build the hype!
Plus don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! They're so easy and keeps people talking about our campaign!

story: The pictures show what remains of the main temples and the pagoda at Tianmen Shan near Zhangjiajie, Hunan Province, China. Tianmen Shan or Heavens Gate Mountain is an incredibly spiritual and stunningly beautiful place. Those who have visited it already know how special it is. It just moves you whether you are spiritual or not. Myself and a group of friends are raising funds to try to get the main temple, the Guan Yin temple, the pagoda, the site access, surrounding walls and buildings rebuilt. Please help us rebuild this incredible place so it can stand for the next 10,000 years.

It just moves you whether you are spiritual or not.   Myself and a group of friends are raising funds to try to get the main temple, the Guan Yin temple, the pagoda, the site access, surrounding walls and buildings rebuilt.  Please help us rebuild this incredible place so it can stand for the next 10,000 years.

story:
Summary

Positive Outcome Mentoring and Dance, Inc. (P.O.M. Squad) is a 501(c)3 organization, with a mission to inspire confidence in girls and help them realize their full potential. We do this through dance training and group mentoring. Coach Tasha, the founder of P.O.M., is a current Washington Redskins Cheerleader. She started this organization because of her passion for dance and her desire to empower girls of all ages.

This campaign is to help P.O.M. purchase two Epsilon Sound Systems ($450/each) and a Generator ($200) for our upcoming Memorial Day parade and they will be used for many more parades in the future. It is important that we reach our goal, otherwise the girls will have difficulty hearing the music. The girls work really hard and look forward to parade day, let's make sure they have an outstanding sound system. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the details:

  • We need $1100, to purchase two Epsilon Airlink 15 Bluetooth Sound Systems ($450/each) and a Generator (approximately $200).
  • Our unique perks include: recognition, t-shirts, free tickets to the Inaugural "Confident Girls Rock Co-Op" and more!

The Impact

Our first parade was the Montgomery County Thanksgiving Parade with only 9 girls. Now, we have over 30 talented and beautiful girls who love the program and who recently performed in the National Cherry Blossom Parade. These opportunities to participate in positive performances and parades, build up the girls' confidence and offer a sense of achievement - and these memories and friendships will last a lifetime.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please help spread the word or inquire about volunteering! We would love to have you.

story:
Fim da campanha

Depois de 45 dias de angariação de fundos para ajudarmos a Beatriz a ter uma educação profissional na área da dança, a campanha chegou ao fim.

Foram muitos os contributos que tivemos, de familiares, de amigos e de desconhecidos, e no conjunto somaram quase 75% do objetivo pretendido.  Não atingimos o total, mas o que conseguimos (fora a percentagem que o próprio sistema nos cobrará) é uma grande ajuda no financiamento dos cursos de verão que a Beatriz fez e que a ajudaram  muito a evoluir e nas despesas que iremos ter no decorrer do próximo ano letivo. A formação que a Beatriz vai fazer este ano implica despesas no alojamento, na escola, na compra regular de variadíssimos materiais (equipamentos de dança, sapatilhas, tutus, etc), nas viagens e inscrições de concursos no estrangeiro, nos terapeutas e mais. 

Para fazermos frente a este desafio esperamos também continuar a contar com o grande apoio que a escola nos tem dado e com a impressionante força de vontade que a Beatriz tem demonstrado. 

Queremos agradecer profundamente às pessoas que nos apoiaram das mais variadas formas, com financiamentos, com a partilha da informação e mesmo com palavras encorajadoras e carinho que nos enviaram e continuam a enviar.

Nós, e a Beatriz, faremos tudo o que pudermos para ter merecido e continuar a merecer esse apoio. Em breve voltarão a ouvir falar dela. Prometemos!

End of Campaign

After 45 days of fundraising to help Beatriz to become a professional dancer the campaign is over.
We had many contributions coming from family members, friends and unknown people reaching almost 75% of our goal. We didn't got the total amount but what we've got (excluding the percentage from the website) it's a great help to finance the summer courses she did and the expenses we will have during the next school year. For the studies she will do now we will have to pay for lodging, for the school, several consumables materials (dance equipment, shoes, tutus, etc..), travels and fees for international competitions, therapists and more.
To face this challenge we also hope to keep the support her school is giving us and with the extreme willpower of Beatriz.
We want to deeply thank everybody that in one way or another have helped us with funds, sharing information or even with words of encouragement and affection.
We, and Beatriz, will make everything we can do deserve and keep deserving your support.
Soon you will hear about her. We promise!

Actualização da Informação

Após a gravação deste vídeo e preparação da campanha de crowdfunding (Maio 2015), houve desenvolvimentos no que se refere à situação da Beatriz. Algumas acções desenvolvidas entretanto levaram a que, após audição, fosse convidada a frequentar uma nova escola de dança em Portugal, para onde irá após frequentar o Amsterdam International Summer School.

A ida para a nova escola de dança implicará viver numa nova cidade onde terá de suportar encargos com alojamento, custos da sua formação em ballet, bem como do material necessário e eventuais participações em concursos de dança. Assim, neste momento, procura-se obter apoio para que ela possa concretizar este sonho e frequentar uma escola de ballet altamente qualificada.


Update on the information

After this video and campaign were prepared (May 2015) the situation regarding Beatriz options has changed. Other actions were taken and she was invited, after an audition, to go to a new dance school in Portugal next year, right after she goes to Amsterdam International Summer School.

Nevertheless, going to a new school means changing from home to a new city, paying the school fees, accommodation, ballet material and also participating in international competitions. Therefore, at this moment, the focus is on gathering support to make this possible and have a high quality ballet training at the new school.


Português (In English below)

O meu nome é Beatriz, tenho 16 anos e quero ser bailarina profissional. Para isso é necessário desenvolver desde muito cedo um grande sentido de expressão bem como um elevado nível técnico.
Sempre vivi numa aldeia em Portugal e só existe uma pequena escola de dança nas redondezas onde comecei a ter aulas de dança desde os 6 anos. No entanto, especialmente nos últimos dois anos, o número de aulas não foi o suficiente. Assim, comecei a viajar aos fins-de-semana para ter aulas em Lisboa e em Elvas e treino sozinha duas vezes por semana num estúdio que a Câmara Municipal tem a amabilidade de me disponibilizar.
Ao todo, treino 10 horas por semana quando deveria estar a treinar pelo menos 20. Mesmo nestas condições, o mês passado consegui ganhar um prémio num concurso em Portugal e fiquei entre as pré-finalistas numa audição em Lausanne.
Isto é mesmo o que eu quero! O ballet é a minha vida, a minha forma de transmitir o que sinto e tornar os outros felizes.  É um caminho verdadeiramente difícil e uma arte muito exigente mas eu estou verdadeiramente empenhada porque não me vejo a fazer mais nada.
Este ano preciso ir mais longe porque não tenho muito mais tempo. As bailarinas começam as suas carreiras por volta dos 18 anos de idade. Quero mudar a minha vida e estou a fazer tudo o que posso para atingir os meus objectivos.
Fui aceite em alguns excelentes cursos intensivos de verão como os da Dutch National Academy, Elmhurst Ballet School e Palucca Schule of Dresden. Se eu tiver a oportunidade de frequentar estes cursos tenho a certeza que a minha técnica e a minha consciência corporal vão melhorar bastante. Para além disso, estes eventos são muitas vezes utilizados pelas escolas para procurar novos alunos e existe a possibilidade de ser convidada para uma boa escola no ano que vem, o que seria o princípio de um sonho tornado realidade.
Estou a fazer o meu melhor para que isto resulte. No entanto, os cursos, os voos e o alojamento são bastante caros e é por isso que eu estou a pedir a vossa ajuda.

Também pode ajudar-me se partilhar esta campanha tanto quanto possível. Para isso pode utilizar as ferramentas de partilha desta página.

Muito obrigada!


English

My name is Beatriz, I’m 16 and I want to become a professional ballerina. This requires not only developing a great sense of expression, but also a high level of technique at a very young age.

I've always lived in a very small village in Portugal and there’s only one small ballet school near by. I started attending to ballet classes since I was 6 years old. However, especially in the last two years, they were not enough. Therefore, I started travelling on weekends to attend classes in  Lisbon and Elvas. I’m also training by myself twice a week in a studio the city hall kindly provides me. This makes 10h per week, and by now I should be training at least 20h. Even in these conditions, last month I managed to win a prize at a competition in Portugal,  and got to the pre-finalists in an audition in Lausanne.
I really want this! Ballet is my life, my way of expression and my way of giving joy and happiness to others. It’s a really hard path, a really demanding art, but I’m committed to it because I can not see myself doing anything else.
This year I need to go further because I really don’t have much more time. Dancers start their careers around 18. I want to change my life and I´m doing everything I can to achieve my goals!
I’ve been accepted to some really good summer intensive courses like the ones from Dutch National Academy, Elmhurst Ballet School and Palucca Schule of Dresden. If I have the opportunity to attend to these summer courses I’m pretty sure my technique and awareness of my body will improve a lot. Besides, these events are often used by schools to search for new students, so there’s always a chance to be invited to a good school next year, which would be the beginning of a dream come true.
I’m doing my best to make this work. However, these courses, the flights and lodging are quite expensive and that’s why I’m asking for your help. 

You can also help me if you share this campaign as much as possible using the sharing tools available in this page.
Thank you very much!
story_txt:
Fim da campanhaDepois
 de 45 dias de angariação de fundos para ajudarmos a Beatriz a ter uma 
educação profissional na área da dança, a campanha chegou ao fim.Foram

 muitos os contributos que tivemos, de familiares, de amigos e de 
desconhecidos, e no conjunto somaram quase 75% do objetivo pretendido.  
Não atingimos o total, mas o que conseguimos (fora a percentagem que o 
próprio sistema nos cobrará) é uma grande ajuda no financiamento dos 
cursos de verão que a Beatriz fez e que a ajudaram  muito a evoluir 
e nas
 despesas que iremos ter no decorrer do próximo ano letivo. A formação 
que a Beatriz vai fazer este ano implica despesas no alojamento, na 
escola, na compra regular de variadíssimos materiais (equipamentos de 
dança, sapatilhas, tutus, etc), nas viagens e inscrições de concursos no
 estrangeiro, nos terapeutas e mais. Para
 fazermos frente a este desafio esperamos também continuar a contar com o
 grande apoio que a escola nos tem dado e com a impressionante força de 
vontade que a Beatriz tem demonstrado. Queremos agradecer profundamente às pessoas que nos apoiaram das mais variadas formas,
 com financiamentos, com a partilha da informação e mesmo com palavras 
encorajadoras e carinho que nos enviaram e continuam a enviar.Nós, e a Beatriz, faremos tudo o que pudermos para ter merecido e continuar a merecer esse apoio. Em breve voltarão a ouvir falar dela. Prometemos!End of CampaignAfter 45 days of fundraising to help Beatriz to become a professional dancer the campaign is over.We
 had many contributions coming from family members, friends and unknown people reaching 
almost 75% of our goal. We didn't got the total amount but what we've 
got (excluding the percentage from the website) it's a great help to 
finance the summer courses she did and the expenses we will have during the next school year. For 
the studies she will do now we will have to pay for lodging, for the 
school, several consumables materials (dance equipment, shoes, tutus, 
etc..), travels and fees for international competitions, therapists and 
more.To face this challenge we also hope to keep the support her school is giving us and with the extreme willpower of Beatriz. We
 want to deeply thank everybody that in one way or another have helped 
us with funds, sharing information or even with words of encouragement 
and affection.We, and Beatriz, will make everything we can do deserve and keep deserving your support.Soon you will hear about her. We promise! Actualização da Informação
Após a gravação deste vídeo e preparação da campanha de crowdfunding (Maio 2015), houve
desenvolvimentos no que se refere à situação da Beatriz. Algumas acções desenvolvidas entretanto levaram a que, após audição, fosse convidada a frequentar uma nova escola de dança em Portugal, para onde irá após frequentar o Amsterdam International Summer School.
A ida para a nova escola de dança implicará viver numa nova cidade onde terá de suportar encargos com alojamento, custos da sua formação em ballet, bem como do material necessário e eventuais participações em concursos de dança. Assim, neste momento, procura-se obter apoio para que ela possa concretizar este sonho e frequentar uma escola de ballet altamente qualificada.Update on the information

After this video and campaign were prepared (May 2015) the situation regarding Beatriz options has changed. Other actions were taken and she was invited, after an audition, to go to a new dance school in Portugal next year, right after she goes to Amsterdam International Summer School.
Nevertheless, going to a new school means changing from home to a new city, paying the school fees, accommodation, ballet material and also participating in international
competitions. Therefore, at this moment, the focus is on gathering support to make this possible and have a high quality ballet training at the new school.

story:
Mercury Hamlet was created to give all actors equal access to the greatest roles in the Classical canon.  Mercury Hamlet is our first production and exploration of William Shakespeare’s HAMLET, told in 90 minutes by an ensemble of 10 actors.

A journey of exploration that began just under a year ago has grown into the Mercury process.  Ten actors with ten tracks completely prepared and ready to perform gather in front of an audience, and subject themselves to the law of the draw to determine which roles they will perform that night.  This non-traditional approach to the play's casting, editing, and production is not designed merely to be challenging and exciting for the performers, but to reinvigorate Shakespeare as theatre for all - not only the highly educated and the elite.  In a bar, in a theatre, in a gym, in the park, we will gather and listen, to tell our story wherever others are willing to gather and listen.

An offer was made to our ensemble to premier at the legendary Chopin Theatre in Chicago in May. Your contributions will go directly toward making this opportunity a reality.

All donations to this fund go toward operating expenses that need to be covered for our premier performance at the Chopin.  Donations will help us cover rental costs for our rehearsal and performance spaces, advertising expenses, and actor salaries and stipends.  With a unique mix of Equity and non-Equity actors, we have not only a desire, but a need to compensate our artists involved with the project.

Mercury Hamlet’s aspirations are to become a training ground and artistic home for the next generation of professional actors.  Just as our ensemble is prepared for anything, we hope to grow a new audience for the American Theatre that is ready for the unexpected and who sees the characters in themselves and themselves in the characters.  Your donations will help bring us closer to this dream.

Check out our perks and donation levels, and please helps us spread the Mercury by sharing our campaign!

story:
The Clown School East's Premiere Production

The Clown School East presents: Shipwrecked! An Entertainment, The Amazing Adventures of Louis de Rougemont (as Told by Himself) by Donald Margulies. This live theatre production is magical, imaginative, and features three talented performers creating wondrous adventures!

The Clown School East is asking for your generosity in helping us make this show a reality. Your donations will bring the spirit of imagination and the magic of theatre to the masses! To all our donors, Thank You, Thank You, and Thank You!

The Clown School East presents: Shipwrecked! An Entertainment, The Adventures of Louis de Rougemont (as Told by Himself) Written by Donald Margulies and Directed by Mike Funt 

The adventurous Louis de Rougemont invites you to hear his amazing story of bravery, survival and celebrity that left nineteenth-century England spellbound. SHIPWRECKED examines how far we're willing to blur the line between fact and fiction in order to leave our mark on the world. The plays tells the grand tale of a famous adventurer who gets lost on the high seas and ends up seeing fantastic things and meeting exotic people. The audience is whisked away from England to the exotic lands of Aboriginal Australia and back again in a story populated by exotic islanders, flying wombats, giant sea turtles and a monstrous man-eating octopus. He is aided by two highly talented players, who play all of the people (and animals) he meets along the way. However, all might not be as it seems…Shipwrecked! brings the joy of storytelling alive, and questions whether a story being real or fabricated makes the journey any less treasured.

The Clown School offers the highest quality of clown training to actors, performers, comedians, and participants from all walks of life, including doctors, teachers, healers, film-makers, and students. We’ve won widespread acclaim for our classes, described as “truly spectacular and unforgettable” in the LA Stage Times and “unbelievable – the best work I’ve ever seen” by comedian June Diane Raphael. After nearly a decade of working with The Clown School in Hollywood, Mike Funt has brought The Clown School's imaginative and hilarious physical theatre sensibilities to the East Coast. The Clown School East has had a very successful year with workshops and events at Workhouse Arts in Lorton, Virginia, ArtFarm in Annapolis, and Greenbelt Community Center, with plans to add more at Washington Improv Theatre and SAK Comedy Lab in 2020. With the success of classes, The Clown School East is proud to announce its foray into production, providing performing opportunities for its students and others in the DC area.

March 20-29 Fridays, Saturdays at 8 p.m., and Sundays show at 2 p.m. at The Greenbelt Arts Center in Greenbelt, MD.

Learn more about the show and buy tickets here: https://www.greenbeltartscenter.org/

http://theclownschool.com

What you are helping to fund

In addition to the obvious budgetary needs that come with a live theatre production such as sets, costumes, licensing rights, posters, postcards, etc., your donation will also help in the following ways: 

  • The performers in this production will be paid, so your donation helps to offer paid professional work for theatre artists in the DC area. A big part of our values as artists is that professional artists be paid for their work. 
  • Helping to provide a baseline budget for future productions. We are already looking to launch a cabaret circus and variety show this summer. The proceeds from this initial show will help us to have a baseline budget for all future projects. 
  • Help us to bring the show on the road. During my tenure with the award winning, and internationally touring Four Clowns, I was able to help facilitate in bringing our productions to festivals and performance venues all over the world. Touring The Clown School East's productions is a high priority, and the proceeds from this initial production will help with future touring performances. 


Don't feel you can contribute right now? We understand! Please consider sharing this project with your friends and family. It's easy, just hit the Share button. :)

story:
What is the show?

We're a group of enthusiastic performers bringing a show to the Edinburgh Fringe 2020.  We're a mix of people including both able bodied and those with disabilities, young actors and experienced pros, an international cast and crew of Scottish, Irish, English and American, working together to put on a series of shows adapted from the great mind of Edgar Allan Poe.  We'll be staging four pieces of his including the Raven and the Black Cat at the centuries old Lauriston Castle just outside of the city but we're going to need your help to do it so read on!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £1000 total including any fees to the platform.  A lot of this will be going toward marketing- it's not a cheap thing to do in Edinburgh and a good half of this money will be going to that alone.  The remainder will be spent on props, costume and miscellaneous items that are required to bring the show to life- such as printed scripts and programmes.

There are a number of reward levels for those contributing but beside the rewards you'll be helping to support the arts.  In a time when funding is almost impossible to obtain, and with people looking for entertainment and distraction from the world around, the arts can offer something wonderful - an escape, a time out, peace of mind and relaxation.  You'd be getting satisfaction at supporting an industry that has helped shape the world around us.  But if that sounds a bit too pretentious, there's some cool merch too!

 

The Impact

Contrary to what many believe, no one is actually paid by "the Fringe" for bringing a show to Edinburgh.  The main way most actors and artists at the Fringe earn from their work (and we all want to do that) is through tickets sold.  Of course it's rarely likely to be a huge amount taken from ticket sales but that amount can dwindle to - in many cases - zero once the costs of actually staging the show are accounted for.  It's no exaggeration that funding from official bodies can be near impossible to obtain, especially with thousands of acts at the Fringe.  You'd be ensuring that the cast and crew can at least come away from the project in a positive way - having earned for their time and effort and work because the production costs are covered.  Small amounts contributed by many mean large amounts don't need to be lost by a few, and we can all work collaboratively, as a collective, to genuinely make the world better - that's what art does.  The impact of your contribution would mean we can bring this project to people, we can give people a chance to relax, to enjoy something and have a couple of hours where they can drift off into another reality.  That's pretty cool. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.  Shout out about the project and share online :)

story:
Who are we?

Bath Spa University has sent a team of student poets to the national university student poetry slam, UNISLAM, for the past 5 years.  As the last remaining university in the UK to offer a performance poetry module our team is coached to demonstrate the creativity and expertise that Bath Spa students have.  Having sent teams that continuously perform well, reaching the semi-finals for the last couple of years and even placing second in 2018, this year's team hopes to continue this legacy.  

Our team is made up of 6 fabulous poets:

Alex Levontine

Holly Moberley

Georgia Stride

Meg Baxter

Raina Greifer

and Sophia Kaniklidou

As well as an amazing coach: Kathryn O'Driscoll

What We Need and What You Could Get

Donations to our campaign will help the team fund:

  • Travel to Birmingham
  • Accomodation
  • Workshops for team members held by local spoken word artists
  • Food and daily expenses while at competition

As a massive thank you to donors we wanted to spice things up and offer some exciting perks you cant miss!

  • A thank you card from the team (and of course, the team mascot Laika the dog): £10
  • A signed copy of a poem by one of the team members (of your choosing or we can surprise you!): £15
  • A printed collection of the poems the team brings to perform at Unislam: £20
  • A Q and A with Laika: £25
  • A personalized thank you video: £30
  • A custom poem by one of the team members (of your choosing or we can surprise you): £50
  • A poem by the star of the team, Laika: £55
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Support this incredible talent both represent their university and take advantage of an amazing profesional opportunity by donating any amount you can- even a little will go a long way!  However, if you arent able to donate support our team by:

* Getting the word out and make some noise about the campaign!

* Follow our team on twitter @BSUpoetryteam!

* Come see us perform!
story_txt:
Who are we?
Bath Spa University has sent a team of student poets to the national university student poetry slam, UNISLAM, for the past 5 years.  As the last remaining university in the UK to offer a performance poetry module our team is coached to demonstrate the creativity and expertise that Bath Spa students have.  Having sent teams that continuously perform well, reaching the semi-finals for the last couple of years and even placing second in 2018, this year's team hopes to continue this legacy.  
Our team is made up of 6 fabulous poets:
Alex Levontine
Holly Moberley
Georgia Stride
Meg Baxter
Raina Greifer
and Sophia Kaniklidou
As well as an amazing coach: Kathryn O'Driscoll

What We Need and What You Could Get
Donations to our campaign will help the team fund:

Travel to Birmingham
Accomodation
Workshops for team members held by local spoken word artists
Food and daily expenses while at competition

As a massive thank you to donors we wanted to spice things up and offer some exciting perks you cant miss!

A thank you card from the team (and of course, the team mascot Laika the dog): £10
A signed copy of a poem by one of the team members (of your choosing or we can surprise you!): £15
A printed collection of the poems the team brings to perform at Unislam: £20
A Q and A with Laika: £25
A personalized thank you video: £30
A custom poem by one of the team members (of your choosing or we can surprise you): £50
A poem by the star of the team, Laika: £55

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Support this incredible talent both represent their university and take advantage of an amazing profesional opportunity by donating any amount you can- even a little will go a long way!  However, if you arent able to donate support our team by:
* Getting the word out and make some noise about the campaign!
* Follow our team on twitter @BSUpoetryteam!
* Come see us perform!

story:
Koresh Dance Company will connect established companies, new faces, repertory favorites, and fresh choreography this summer when it presents 33 dance companies in its third annual Come Together Dance Festival at the Suzanne Roberts Theatre in Philadelphia. The festival, which began in 2013, celebrates the diversity, creativity, and technical excellence of Philadelphia’s dance community. From July 22nd to the 26th, its mixed programs will stage modern dance alongside tap and contemporary ballet, juxtaposing distinct styles from hip hop to acrobatic physical theater in what the Philadelphia Dance Journal has called “serious Philly flava.”

In past years, the festival received foundation support to supplement our production costs. These monies directly impacted theater rental, professional lighting design and compensation for participants.

Despite generous support from the Knight Foundation, this year we received only a fourth of the monies needed to cover these production expenses.

Without this financial backing, we need your help to make our third year the best year yet.

Koresh aims to increase access to dance and awareness of the city’s rich movement cultures by assembling numerous unique styles in a single festival. In 2013, the Dance Journal called this effort “a rousing success” that “reflected a healthy, diverse Philly dance scene.” The Philadelphia Weekly hailed the 2014 festival as “tak[ing] the art to a whole new level.”

Koresh Dance Company, now approaching its 25th anniversary, seeks new life for Philadelphia dance. Artistic Director Ronen (Roni) Koresh values collaboration with regional companies and choreographers, and launched the Come Together Dance Festival with his brother, Executive Director Alon Koresh, in order to provide a platform for networking and mutual support in the dance community. Hip hop artist, photographer, and filmmaker Raphael Xavier, who has performed in both previous festivals, calls Come Together “a great opportunity” for dancers to motivate each other and learn from one another’s craft. “I was inspired by other artists’ work,” Xavier comments. “It made me realize I have to keep pushing towards a high standard of performance art and dance.”

Since emigrating from Israel to the United States, Roni and Alon Koresh have been active in the Philadelphia dance scene for nearly 25 years. They both recall the generosity and artistic solidarity that furnished their early opportunities in the city—the foundational steps that led to the founding of the Koresh Dance Company and School of Dance. The Koresh brothers feel that it is their turn to contribute performance opportunities to the city’s young and innovative choreographers, and to bring its luminaries together for a week of diverse and excellent performances.

This year's roster includes: Spectrum Dance Theater +Donald Byrd; Brian Sanders' JUNK; Koresh Dance Company; Kulu Mele African Dance and Drum Ensemble; Kun-Yang Lin/Dancers; Philadanco! The Philadelphia Dance Company; Raphael Xavier; Rennie Harris Puremovement; 10 Hairy Legs; Ashley Garcia-Rameau; Alchemy Dance Company; Anne-Marie Mulgrew & Dancers Company; Ballet Inc.; Chisena Danza (Melissa Chisena); The Clutch Collective; Connolly & Co. (Lauren Connolly); Evalina Wallis Cain Carbonell; Face Da Phlave Entertainment/Theatre; idiosynCrazy productions; Just Sole: Street Dance Theater; Kareem B. Goodwin; Kat J. Sullivan; Katrina Atkin; Koresh Youth Ensemble; Koresh School of Dance; Matt Soojian; Project Moshen Dance Company; Putty Dance Project; Sakshi Productions; SANBROOKA Productions; SHARP Dance Company;The Rock School for Dance Education; Tara Madsen Dance (TAra Madsen Robbins)

Help get Philly on its feet! Donate to the Come Together Dance Festival today!

story:
Summary

Tango'd Up in Blues (TUIB) has been bringing Blues and Tango dance to the Playa since 2009. Year-round, we work on improvements to our offering, from collaborations with other camps, to recruiting more fantastic teachers, to upgrading our infrastructure. Unfortunately, so many artists bring an immense amount of talent to the table, but not a ton of money. That's why we're asking you to help us out! With $3500, we can build the best darn dance floor the playa has ever seen. With $5000, we can make necessary replacements to our playa-ravaged sound system and store our infrastructure during the non-dusty parts of the year. And if we could, by some wonderful chance, raise $10000+, we could purchase some dearly needed infrastructure and provide shade and comfortable areas for our campers and the Burning Man public alike. Please help us make our camp as beautiful, inviting, and comfortable as it can be, as we strive to introduce new souls to the joy of dance!

Dance

“All the ills of mankind, all the tragic misfortunes that fill the history books, all the political blunders, all the failures of the great leaders have arisen merely from a lack of skill at dancing.” - Molière

Dang. Is freeing people really as easy as teaching them to dance? We got this covered. :)

About Tango'd Up In Blues

Hello! I'm Sam, and I'm leading Tango'd Up in Blues, our Burning Man camp for 2015. 

Our fifty-some dancers, ranging from beginners to internationally-recognized instructors, all share a love of our craft. We work as a team in a harsh environment, teaching dance during the day and hosting parties from dusk 'til dawn. We're consistently rewarded with premier camp placement, including this year.

Human beings are all searching for connection with others, whether we know it or not. Partner dance is one of the best, safest ways to satisfy that need. What we do positively impacts people. I can tell you, it's been transformative for me, personally, and that's why I'm such an advocate of what we do. 

The further we spread this skill, the happier and more peaceful the world will be. I’m asking you, on behalf of camp, to help us level up what we’re bringing to the playa this year.

Why Do We Need Dance?

Long story short, I was raised in a pretty brutal environment. As a result, I was guarded and coldhearted well into my thirties. I learned Lindy Hop because I thought it was cool, then spent eighteen months doing more dictating than listening on the dance floor. 

Eventually I found fusion dancing. I remember feeling apprehensive at the freeform style. "There’s no regimented 8-count? What sorcery is this?” I attended class after class and danced all night. It wasn’t big and flashy, but intimate. I had dances where we never left close embrace and didn’t move more than an inch the whole time, but the connection was profound. It was then that I realized the style of dance I need is not about how many moves you know, but about connection between partners. You can only get that kind connection by being vulnerable and receptive, but once you are, you find ways to drop a lot of garbage you’re carrying around. 

That transformed me from a guy who dances, into a dancer. That’s how I identify now. I’m certainly not the best, and I learn every time I go out on the floor. The community I’ve found has become my chosen family, and I want everyone to have an opportunity to experience that type of human connectedness. 

That's why I'm such an advocate of what we do. The further we spread this skill, the happier and more peaceful the world will be. I’m asking you, on behalf of camp, to help us level up what we’re bringing to the playa this year.

What We Need

Every year, we get bigger and better at what we do. Our dance surface has evolved from linoleum rolled out on the playa to a modular OSB floor to our most ambitious project yet:  We've designed and are building 1400 square feet of what we believe will be the first portable, quadruple-sprung floating dance floor on playa. It's going to be amazing. 

As much as we love to dance, (and believe me, some of us will go from 9pm to 5am) a limiting factor is joint or muscle fatigue from dancing on hard surfaces. Back in the day, high-end dance halls had floors supported by springs made of hundreds of 1x3 wooden slats. They weren’t actually woven, but laid out in layers at right angles to each other and offset from the layers in the same orientation. 

The pieces of flooring were supported by the underlying grid. This way, a dancer’s weight was never transmitted directly to the ground and voila - a fun, floaty-feeling floor that faithfully foils fatigue!

That may be easier to say than visualize so I here is a picture of a layout of the springs:

and a clip of me and Zosha making a scene in Home Depot, featured in the video at the top of the page. :)

Technical Stuff

We’re sourcing 44 sheets of very high grade 3/4” T&G OSB for our dance surface. It’s manufactured by huberwoods.com and is much stiffer, more water resistant and more durable than anything else on the market. The best price I could find is $35 per sheet, plus delivery. We will also need about 425 utility grade 1x3s and three thousand feet of mule tape to tie it all together. Those are $1.92 each and $190, respectively, plus shipping. Next, five gallons of sealer for $160 and six gallons of gloss finish for $423 to make sure this floor is smooth, level and dancer-proof.  Finally we’ll need some tools and fasteners: staple guns, staples, a couple 50-foot tapes, brushes and rollers to apply layers of sealer and finish, enough 2x4 material to build drying racks for our new floor and a quality circular saw and jigsaw to be used on this and future projects. 

The labor is free: we’re handling everything as a crew at our pre-playa build party! 

Added up, I expect our costs will run to $3419 for a portable floor that will lay out in a few hours, last a decade and delight thousands of dancers. Any extra monies will go to support our sound equipment and year-round storage of our infrastructure. If y'all are REALLY generous, we might even be able to afford a shade structure!

What You Get

We’re offering playlists, hugs, private music performance, pickles, a psychedelic color-changing dome to blow your mind, and the opportunity to have your name burned directly on our dance floor. It’s like the Walk of Fame but at the biggest festival you can imagine! Check out the swag! 

The Impact

You can’t see it in the video, but when Zosha first stepped on the floor, the look on her face was priceless: all surprise and delight. Something as simple as a piece of OSB over a few sticks of wood arranged in a certain way, and BAM! Happiness. 

As far as I know, nothing like this has been done before. With this large, improved floor design we will delight guests all night and the word will spread. 

We are already in contact with other dance camps who admire our audacity and are ready to adopt our design once we show it can be done. Remember the quote at the top of the page - skill in dance can save the world! Don’t you want to be part of this? :)

Our Friends, Light At Play

If you were wowed by that beautiful Radiance Dome in the video above, join the very impressed club! Light At Play has been creating beautiful light structures since 2013, and we are honored to have been the home for the dome for the past two years. This year, damages from past Burns have rendered the dome unready for such a harsh environment, and it will not be joining us for the Burn. If you want to make sure that comes back in 2016, as we dearly hope it will, talk to us about donating to their upgrades or renting the dome for your event! Lower prices than seen in the perks are available. ;)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you think what we’re doing is valuable, you can support us in ways beyond donations. Link to us, use your social networks to spread the word about this project, or use the Indiegogo share tools. 

Thank you. We really appreciate you and all you do. 

Save us a dance!


Credits:

Clips from the video by Light At Play, our beloved and wildly talented friends: http://lightatplay.net/

Perks made by Twin Ravens Press. Check them out for fantastic engraved and printed materials: http://twinravenspress.com/

Music: The song in the first clip of the video is Diamond in Disguise, by our friends Chance's End. You can even see Ryan playing that very song in the clip! Check them out here: https://chancesend.bandcamp.com/

story:
Anton Chekhov Book Club

When you love a book, you enter another world...

Four eccentric women brought together by their love for the literary giant, Anton Chekhov, lose themselves - and find themselves - in the pages of his timeless short stories.

Driven by the characters’ desires to seek connections with one another and to more deeply understanding themselves, The Anton Chekhov Book Club's women explore the joys, intricacies, vulnerabilities, passions, and heartaches of life through the multi-faceted short stories they bring to life.
The Anton Chekhov Book Club performs at Stage 773 in Chicago 
Fridays at 8 PM through September 25, 2015
Click here for
TICKETS FOR THE ANTON CHEKHOV BOOK CLUB

The Moving Dock Theatre Company

We're searching for something here at Moving Dock Theatre Company...

We are a group of theatre artists who have been delving into the questions of life both through the material we choose and through the creative process. The Michael Chekhov Technique has given us a unique way to explore such questions by approaching our stories through movement, imagination, and soul. 

Chekhov on Chekhov

Our followers who know us on Facebook or Twitter, know that we talk a lot about Chekhov - BOTH Chekhovs . These two Chekhov's compliment each other so well. Anton, the brilliant writer, who observed life with an critical  yet compassionate eye and Michael, nephew of Anton, and an equally brilliant  actor and teacher who pioneered the process for the art of the actor by showing actors how to dive beneath the surface of a character to embody life more fully. 

In The Anton Chekhov Book Club we have brought together the two Chekhovs in our work to bring you some of Anton Chekhov's stories (stories you might not know)  as well as the discoveries we've made along the way! 

We are excited  to share with you what we are finding in our newest show, The Anton Chekhov Book Club. 

About the Campaign...

As a tiny company of artists concerned as much (or more) with the inner as the outer, it always amazes us how even the most bare-bones project can have so many needs... for which we need...money. 

Stage 773 Box Partnership- Helping artists bring their work to the stage.

We are so grateful to have been selected as a  Stage 773 Box Partner. This honor goes a long way towards making this show possible. Now we must  find the remaining production funding needed to bring a show from the studio to the stage.

What We Need-

Your contribution will help in the following capacity:

  • Paying our artists and crew. As a professional theatre, we are committed to  paying our artist and crew. With your help, we can acknowledge the value of their developed talent, professionalism, work, and dedication.

    • Our performers have worked tirelessly on their performances and adapting the stories into a cohesive and intricately woven show.

    • We have THE BEST costume designer, the lovely and talented Erin Rose Gallagher, who can work miracles, but dressing ladies who obsess about late 19th century Russian writers, could happen better with your generosity.

    • Our photographer, Jazmin Corona, and our Graphic Designer, Sarah Stec, have already been dedicating many hours to this project, and with your help we can actually pay them.

  • Costumes. Our Stage 773 Box Partnership agreement said we would be simple, but it didn't say we wouldn't be as BEAUTIFUL  as possible. Your donation will mean dressing the Anton Chekhov Book Club the way in which the ladies would approve.

  • The future of the show. We hope to continue development of The Anton Chekhov Book Club  beyond this fall production at Stage 773. Your support will help to further the realization of this beautiful production's full potential. 

What You Get

For your contribution, you will get:
  • to write it off as a tax deduction!
  • to be a partner in art by making a world premier happen
  • to see new views of life as you help us bring great literature to the stage
  • to make a HUGE difference in supporting a quality art event in your community
  • to support the continued growth and success of a small theatre company 
  • PLUS - we have many perks for you Chekhov lovers at every contribution level, including books by the amazing Anton Chekhov.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter
  • Come see the show!

What We Need-
Your contribution will help in the following capacity:


Paying our artists and crew. As a professional theatre, we are committed to  paying our artist and crew. With your help, we can acknowledge the value of their developed talent, professionalism, work, and dedication.

Our performers have worked tirelessly on their performances and adapting the stories into a cohesive and intricately woven show.



We have THE BEST costume designer, the lovely and talented Erin Rose Gallagher, who can work miracles, but dressing ladies who obsess about late 19th century Russian writers, could happen better with your generosity.
Our photographer, Jazmin Corona, and our Graphic Designer, Sarah Stec, have already been dedicating many hours to this project, and with your help we can actually pay them.




Costumes. Our Stage 773 Box Partnership agreement said we would be simple, but it didn't say we wouldn't be as BEAUTIFUL  as possible. Your donation will mean dressing the Anton Chekhov Book Club the way in which the ladies would approve.



The future of the show. We hope to continue development of The Anton Chekhov Book Club  beyond this fall production at Stage 773. Your support will help to further the realization of this beautiful production's full potential. 

What You Get
For your contribution, you will get:
to write it off as a tax deduction!
to be a partner in art by making a world premier happen

to see new views of life as you help us bring great literature to the stage


to make a HUGE difference in supporting a quality art event in your community


to support the continued growth and success of a small theatre company 

PLUS - we have many perks for you Chekhov lovers at every contribution level, including books by the amazing Anton Chekhov.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter
Come see the show!

story:
Ohana Arts invites you to pledge a crane in support of Sadako Sasaki's message told through the groundbreaking new musical, Peace On Your Wings!  For every $5 pledge, a cast member will fold 1 crane on your behalf, which will end up in the upcoming performances of Peace On Your Wings at Hawaii Theatre and/or the Aratani Theatre in Los Angeles, California, as well as in the Ohana Arts summer show, "Live Peace".  This pledge drive will help Ohana Arts continue to send Peace On Your Wings, and Sadako's message around the world!

Just as Sadako Sasaki’s middle school friends from the “Bamboo Club” came together to raise money to create a monument in Sadako’s name to remember her legacy, we are launching a similar effort, a sort of “Ohana Arts Bamboo Club”, where we are continuing to spread her message through cranes, through the message of “Peace On Your Wings”, and by making others aware of her story and message.   We invite you to please join us in this movement and share our links, contribute, and fold some cranes!

About the Musical

Peace On Your Wings (Music by Jenny Taira, Lyrics by Laurie Rubin, Book by Jenny Taira & Laurie Rubin) is an original musical inspired by the life of Sadako Sasaki which juxtaposes her story and the events leading up to her death in November 1955 with a fictional story about a group of her friends who rallied support from around Japan to have a monument built in Sadako’s memory to honor the children victims of the atomic bomb.  The fictional elements of the musical provide an opportunity to weave in issues such as bullying that affect children in middle school today.  This groundbreaking show premiered on Oahu in November 2014 to a sold-out crowd.  The cast then embarked on a sold-out statewide tour.  The overwhelmingly positive response has led to an encore performance in Honolulu, as well as plans for US and Japan tours in 2015 & 2016.

More than a play

Peace On Your Wings is more than a musical theater play.  It is part of a continual movement to educate children and adults alike about the important global message of peace.  It is a way to get people to connect with an under recognized piece of history more than any textbook could convey.  Music is a universal language everyone understands which touches people’s deepest vulnerability and emotions.  Music has been utilized for centuries as the most visceral way to personally connect people with current events and past atrocities so that history will not repeat itself.  Responses to the world premiere of Peace On Your Wings have been overwhelmingly touching and positive.  Audience members who were not familiar with Sadako’s story have now taken her message to heart. 

Other audience members were victims of the atomic bombs dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki themselves, and were moved deeply by our cast of children, saying that they truly paid homage to Sadako and others like her who suffered the after effects.  Many audience members were children, and we were told by their parents that the musical both entertained and moved them.  The goal of Peace On Your Wings is to bring Sadako’s story to many more audiences, to show how it is the little gestures that make a big difference, and to teach the lesson of “Ichigo Ichie.”  It is a show that will educate audiences of American children and adults alike about a piece of history which greatly affected those in Hiroshima.

Professional theater by youth for all generations

The creators of Peace On Your Wings wanted to write a professional, “adult” piece of musical theater that was challenging, yet appropriate for the ages and vocal ranges of youth performers.  There is a dearth of repertoire of this genre in the musical theater world, as musicals are most often written with the intent of being produced on Broadway or by other professional theater companies with a majority of adult performers.  Youth theater actors are often relegated to adult roles with inappropriate content that needs to be altered, or watered down children’s theater with simplified music and basic story lines.  Conversely, there are a number of theater groups dedicated to commissioning and performing plays and musicals for children, but they are comprised of adult performers.  Peace On YourWings is one of the only plays of its kind, written for an all-youth cast ages 6-18, with content suitable and appropriate for a wide age range of students, and also comprises a substantial educational element by sharing an important piece of world history. 

New voices in musical theater

Finally, Asians and Asian Americans are greatly underrepresented in musical theater, and Peace On Your Wings greatly enriches the repertoire for the pool of talented youth Asian actors who have dreams and aspirations of pursuing musical theater careers, and are deprived of opportunities to perform due to typecasting and limited roles.  Because musical theater has been effective in educating audiences about various aspects of history, current events, and issues relevant to a variety of audiences, it is necessary to continue to tell stories that haven’t yet been told via musical theater, and to give voice to those who haven’t been heard.

Your support is needed!

Ohana Arts, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization and producer of Peace On Your Wings is seeking support for an international tour through the US mainland and Japan, where Sadako’s message of peace can continue to be spread through the powerful voices of children.

story:
Short Summary

The Musical Theatre Club is very excited to present a fully student run production of RENT the musical. We decided to perform this particular show because it encompasses our campus culture and diversity. This show explores previously taboo subject matters and teaches acceptance of all people. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will go towards funding different aspects of our production such as

  • The set, including the iconic RENT scaffolding. 
  • Costumes
  • Props
  • Lighting and sound equipment.

Costumes

Lighting and sound equipment.

story:
The Project

Dark Lord: The Musical is an exciting new animated musical web series with script and lyrics by Michael Daniel, Ben Collins, and Gina Reynolds, and music by Michael Daniel. It will be starring Ewan Chung as the Dark Lord and Abby Cluster as Absidy, the Fairy Princess. We are looking to air the first episode on Halloween of this year.

The Story

Eight thousand moons ago the Dark Lord Saurnimort (the “T” is silent, you petulant pissants!) found himself cast upon the magical plane of Musilasia – a land where all beings great and small are compelled to burst into spontaneous song and dance – whether they want to or not. After several failed attempts to return to his home plane, Camorhog, Saurnimort had no choice but to resign himself to a life in the eternally and infuriatingly cheery land of Musilasia – but he doesn’t have to like it.

Thwarted at every step by his arch nemesis, The White Wizard Merdalfdore (also known as The Sleep Walker, due to his narcoleptic tendencies), Saurnimort attempts to contrive a spell that will rid Musilasia of its melodious blight. His latest scheme requires the still-beating heart of a fairy, and Saurnimort has set his eyes on Absidy, daughter of The Fairy Queen – but with this feisty fairy, the Dark Lord may have bitten off more than he can chew.

With an eclectic supporting ensemble of fantasy characters – including Larry the Minion, Captain Awesome, Professor Bumblebee, and The White Witch Neandrathill – Dark Lord: The Musical promises to be an entertaining and epic musical sendup of the fantasy genre.

What We Need and What YOU Get

In order to bring this cool new musical to the internet, we need to raise $10,000 to pay the voice actors. Actors need food, too. Any additional money raised if we surpass our goal will be applied to marketing and advertising the series.

We are offering a variety of perk options. Perks included:

  • Production updates as series progresses
  • First look at each episode 1 week before each release date
  • Posters signed by the cast and crew
  • Digital/Physical copies of the album* (physical CD albums will be signed by the cast)
  • DVD of the complete series*
  • Select pages of the score, signed by the writers
  • Complete piano-vocal songbooks signed by the writers*
  • Copies of the script signed by the writers*
  • Executive Producer/Producer credit
*These items will be delivered after the completion of the series in order to protect the plot of the story from being spoiled

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can pledge money. We get that. Even if you can't give money, you can make a huge difference just by spreading the word. Word of mouth often makes all the difference in these crowd funding campaigns.

  • Let all the musical theater fans in your life know about the show, and our campaign
  • Share links to our homepage (www.darklordmusical.com) or the campaign page on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, etc.
